story:
Can you imagine your childhood without books?

Now imagine a childhood without water, electricity, and only a dirt floor beneath your feet. Imagine what owning a book would do for a child living in such spartan conditions. Imagine the worlds it would open for her and her dreams beginning to flower, nurtured solely by the magic of language. This begins our fourth year of a successful reading project for children in the rural communities surrounding San Miguel de Allende, Mexico.

Our dreams have grown with our successes.

This year our intention is to reach over 700 children (last year was 500) with a book and a chance to meet the author in November.

This year we will provide two workshops for those teachers who will be participating in our project (representing 20 schools or programs). Last year we provided one workshop for 12 represented schools or programs.

This will be our first year to include workshops with parents in each of the rural communities. Our hope is that helping to educate the parents about reading will increase the desire for the children. There are some parents who are illiterate and in fact may be read to by their children.

What we are asking for
We especially need your support to purchase books, to transport the children to events, and to support our teacher training and parent education programs.
Please help us sustain this effort so that we might create a lasting program that fosters reading and cultural exchange.

We need your help and support! 

We are asking for a total of $5,000 USD towards this year’s budget. You will be helping to foster community growth through the invaluable benefits of reading.  You will be contributing to the future of children in the educational systems. You will be supporting the message that so much more is possible as long as one's imagination can thrive.

Budget for 2016 Libros para Todos project (in USD)


700 books @ $2.00/book ....................................$1400
50 books (“Anna, verdad?”) @ $5.00 .................$ 250
Honorarium ............................................................$1000
Author travel expenses ...........................................$ 500
Transportation for students, promotion, misc. ....$ 750
Two Workshops for teachers ................................$1000
Workshops for parents ...........................................$ 800
                                          
                                                                                                                   TOTAL  $5,700*
*We receive additional support from other sources.             

“Any book that helps a child form the habit of reading, to make reading one of his deep and continuing needs, is good for him."

There are some parents who are illiterate and in fact may be read to by their children.What we are asking forWe especially need your support to purchase books, to transport the children to events, and to support our teacher training and parent education programs.Please help us sustain this effort so that we might create a lasting program that fosters reading and cultural exchange.We need your help and support! We are asking for a total of $5,000 USD towards this year’s budget. You will be helping to foster community growth through the invaluable benefits of reading.  You will be contributing to the future of children in the educational systems. You will be supporting the message that so much more is possible as long as one's imagination can thrive.Budget for 2016 Libros para Todos project (in USD)700 books @ $2.00/book ....................................$140050 books (“Anna, verdad?”) @ $5.00 .................$ 250Honorarium ............................................................$1000Author travel expenses ...........................................$ 500Transportation for students, promotion, misc. ....$ 750Two Workshops for teachers ................................$1000Workshops for parents ...........................................$ 800                                                                                                                                                             TOTAL  $5,700**We receive additional support from other sources.             “Any book that helps a child form the habit of reading, to make reading one of his deep and continuing needs, is good for him."

story:
The clinics & challenges season is looming over us and I find myself tight on money, but not on time! I have had several setbacks this year, following two surgeries to the guts. That gutted (pun intended!) my savings for this summer.

Meet Ruten, a 9-month old Aussie who helped me fight back a depression past fall and who brought me back to my feet, health-wise. I want to give back to him and train him to herding. He likes running, he likes sheep but the main training facility is four hours away and my teacher can't van her sheep to my house (I wish! But the neighbours would hate me)

This fundraising is to allow me and Ruten to train accordingly and travel back and forth between the training farm and my home.

Any supplement money would be given to a charity of your choice!

Why this much? 

  • Each clinic costs 200$ and there are two of them.
  • Each bi-monthly lesson costs 45$
  • Renting a car for two days cost 85$/day
1160$ will cover these fees appropriately. 
Thank you so much!

story:
Let us introduce ourselves

JTM’s Mission is to reach out to the youth through the teachings of St. John Paul II’s TOB by offering training, workshops, resources, retreats, and collaboration  opportunities for youth animators and confirmation teachers within the Archdiocese, as well as trainings, retreats and catechetical events for the youth themselves through the TOB ENCOUNTER and its follow up programs, and the High School and College presentations.

Our Dream

Most of our group members come from very humble families.  Most of our team members are still studying. As you may be aware our Archdiocese in Kolkata is in no position to be able to fund this project.

  • Our Dream is to make a pilgrimage to Poland the Birth land of John Paul II
  • We need 4500 US Dlls for the flights and Registration of at least five members of our team to go to the WYD 2016 in Poland.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal the funds would go to support our ministry with the youth in West Bengal, for we are all students and have unlimited needs but very limited budgets.

The Impact of our Ministry in Kolkata:

What our youth are saying (excerpts of their Personal Commitment) after living the TOB ENCOUNTER (Two Days Retreat):
• “After encountering Jesus through TOB and the love He has for us, I realized that Love needs to be enacted out. What touched me was that through one’s BODY we can connect ourselves to God. TOB is not just about relationship with people, about our desires, but it is about selfless giving of ourselves. TOB made me realize we have hope in Jesus!”- Ajay Bilung

• “I loved the talks and sessions. I discovered I am awesome. I am precious child of my Father! This Encounter has bought me closer to God. Now I am not hiding my sins.”- Patrick Rosario

• “I realized that it is never too late to turn from the darkness to the light of God. I am eager and pray for wisdom to God and St. John Paul 2 to know more about Theology of the Body and to Encounter Jesus Christ”. - Daniel Gomes

• “All the testimonies shared by the JTM members really touched me. It made me realize that I’m not the only one who is hurt. I realized I need to spend more time with God and build a strong relationship with Him.” – Sophia Rosario

• “The talks were awesome the videos and the films were terrific. I am proud to be a Catholic” – Sonu Minj

• “I have inner peace. This ECOUNTER brought me closer to Jesus I had never experienced such a peaceful and enriching retreat. This ECOUNTER gave a proper meaning to my life. I am a changed person now.” – Sourav Ekka

• “I was blessed by the testimonies of the team, by their joy in the Lord, by the reminder that God has created my heart for Love and to Love, that only he can fully satisfy my heart. The time of Adoration was a beautiful Encounter with the the Love of Jesus.” – Susanna de Almeida

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please pray for us and help us by getting the word out and make some noise about our campaign

story:
Buy shares of "Stock" in the Mission Trip!

Youth from Saint James Cathedral in Seattle are traveling to Nicaragua in August to spend a week in kinship and solidarity with children living in an NPH orphanage. We are actively working with NPH, a system of orphanage homes, to engage in a unique mission devoted to closeness & mutuality with the poor.

Pope Francis has told us that "we have much to learn from the poor." Our team of 26 youth and adult leaders desire to do just that. We will be developing understanding and friendship with those who would otherwise be marginalized.  We hope to become a Church both for and with the poor.

Each "stock" purchase will help offset the high cost of travel associated with planning this trip. We hope you can help them in this exciting opportunity!

story: I'm hoping to raise £2000 to help me achieve NQT Status. This qualification will help make my dream to move to Pembrokeshire a reality and start the rest of my life. After 2 years and completing a £5000 teaching qualification, it transpires I cannot actively teach in Wales on this QTS equivalent. As I'm a lone parent I just cannot save after paying out my entire income to get by. I'm gutted that I feel as though my last 2 years of study is rendered worthless, and has now pushed my student loan into excess of £20,000. The money for this course stands between me and my future, which I am so close to achieving.. Please help if you think I'm worth it.

story:
Dear Friends!
Each year, we fundraise in June to send childcare volunteers + workshop leaders to participate in the Allied Media Conference. This conference helps us connect to other Childcare Collectives + is a crucial part of sustaining the work we do in Chicago. Please help us get there!
---------------

Who is the Chicago Childcare Collective (ChiChiCo)?

ChiChiCo, formed in 2008, is a group of volunteers who support the participation of parents and guardians, especially mothers, in racial and economic justice work. The collective matches volunteers with community organizations across the city. Volunteers play with kids while their parents participate in and lead organizing efforts to defend community rights and build a better Chicago.

-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- ---- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --

What is the Allied Media Conference (AMC)?

The AMC is an annual conference in Detroit (June 16 - 19) where individuals and groups come together to share tools and tactics for transforming our communities through media-based organizing.

Check out their website for more info -- http://alliedmedia.org/

-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- ---- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --

So what is Chichico doing at AMC?

ChiChiCo is super psyched to be collaborating with other Childcare Collectives around the US to facilitate a whole 'track' of 11 workshops (including 'intergenerational storytelling' and 'outdoor games for love and liberation') for children ages 4-12. We're also providing childcare for children under 4 at the conference!

Each year, this annual fundraiser allows us to support a national movement of prioritizing kids by supporting the participation of parents and caregivers in community organizing, and by including kids in beautiful social justice work!

-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- ---- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --

And Beyond!

Participating in AMC helps us to reenergize,  learn from other childcare collectives and organizers, and expand our support for both the Chicago community and other national childcare collectives. Each year we come home with new ideas for radical play and ways to sustain our work as Chichico.

-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- ---- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --

We are fundraising to cover the costs of:

$300 for food and meals

$250 toward donation to AMC (as volunteers, we try to pay as much of the registration fee as we can to make the conference possible each year)

$300 for travel expenses (by car)

$100 for materials and supplies

$50 for Indiegogo fees

GOAL: $1,000

-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- ---- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --

Other Ways You Can Help:

- Please forward this link to friends and talk about how important radical childcare is for children, parents, and our communities!

- Volunteer! We are always hoping to bring more folks in. http://www.chichico.org/volunteer/

To request childcare for your radical organizing event please visit our website or e-mail us at chichildcareco [at] gmail [dot] com

-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- ---- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --

See you at AMC!!!!

story:
Kung Fu Training

The discipline and training of ninjas has captured Alon's attention. In one week, he went from no interest in drawing to drawing ninjas non-stop.  Recognizing passion, we introduced him to the Tat Wong Kung Fu Academy in the stately bank building he passes everyday going to school. He has taken a trial class and is determined to study at the Academy. 


The Tat Wong is a serious studio and requires children to train twice a week for at least six months.  We have asked Alon to go to his community with his commitment and ask for their support.  Alon says he wants to train because

  • It looks fun
  • Kung Fu helps your strength, concentration, discipline, and respect

Alon is a gifted ambassador who connects easily with adults and children alike.  He has adapted well to San Francisco and his new school. The order and strict hierarchy of Kung Fu provides a sharp contrast to the Montessori education Alon is receiving.  A committed study will provide him with

  • Skills to navigate competitve, goal oriented environments
  • Perserverence
  • Team development in the multi-cultural, multi-lingual community of the Inner Richmond
The upfront costs are difficult for Alon's parents navigating a cross-country move. Alon's commitment and determination are so strong we are coming to you, his community, for assistance. Alon needs $640 to cover the tuition costs of 6 months of lessons.

He is offering people

  • At the $10 level he will send you an original Ninja drawing
  • At the $25 level he will send you a personal thank you video
  • At the $45 level Alon will give you a private showcase of his new skills (if you come visit us!)

His parents are offering to make the necessary arrangements to get him to class 2-3 times each week. Thanks for helping make Alon's education more rich and rewarding!

story:
Help Two Oz Celebrities Fund-raising for Trip to Help the L. Frank Baum Foundation & 

Additional Fund-raising Efforts for the Purchase of Baum & Neal House Syracuse, NY 

 

 A Special Note from Executive Director of 

L. Frank Baum Foundation, Kathleen Sorbello Di Scenna....

The Lyman Frank Baum Foundation, Inc. is happy to support both Aaron Pacentine and Ron Baxley Jr. in their efforts. We at the foundation look forward to their coming to the Without This Home There'd Be No Oz! fundraiser in August, in Syracuse NY. Your most generous donations are appreciated.

Thank you.

Executive Director - Kathleen Sorbello Di Scenna

 

Aaron Pacentine, producer, director, and filmmaker of the documentary, “The Wonderful World of Oz”  online Oz site,  TheWizardofOzFilm.com, and Oz fan and Oz craftsman of many years, and Ron Baxley, Jr., honored Oz author of 14 years who has been formally invited to many Oz events and overall published, charitable author of 21 years, are raising money for a trip to a fund-raising event by the L. Frank Baum Foundation to purchase the Baum and Neal House in Syracuse, New York, the home where Baum first met his wife Maud and without which “The Wonderful Wizard of Oz” may never have been written. It is crucial that this historical property so key to the entire world of Oz and Oz fandom be purchased and maintained for prosperity. 

Pacentine, who has been not only an Oz fan but connected to the Oz community since 2005, after Warner Brothers re-released the film on DVD. He had had the honor of interviewing many people in the Oz communtiy in audio interviews and this August his new film, "The Wonderful World fo Oz" will be presented in the historical Landmark Theater in New York. He is donating his time to the Foundation. Pacentine will be also donating  replica reproduction keys from the “Return to Oz” film and  copies of his DVD with personal letters to everyone that donates.  These will be offered for different levels of donations to this effort. They will be available via postal mail and at the event itself. (See www.familyfilmsproductions.com and www.thewizardofozfilm.com  for more information about Pacentine and his business and efforts) 


Here's what a few people have to say about "The Wonderful World of Oz" - 

From Dorothy Gita Morena - 

"What a great collection of memories and experiences around Oz. It is amazing to me to see how deeply my great grandfathers work has touched so many people. I am honored to be in his family and carry on the legacy. Thank you so much for all the work you put into this…..and supporting the community of Oz this way".  

From Oz Author, Collector, and fan Jared Davis - 

"The whole documentary is done with the conceit that you're on a trip to visit all these fans, however, to visually get this across, we zoom into map websites....   To dedicated Oz fans, there's plenty here to interest you. ....there's enough to justify adding it to your collection.

From Oz Fan Michael in Illinois -

"The menu graphics and cover were really well done.  So glad you captured all those stories on film!  Time passes too quickly.  When we realize what's gone, it's too late to document it!"


Cards and prints from the “The Evil and prints through this crowd fund-raising campaign will be used for the trip. Sales during the weekend itself will be donated to the L. Frank Baum Foundation. Books, cards, and prints, etc. will be offered for sale via postal mail and during the weekend of the event. (See http://www.reimannbooks.comhttp://www.lulu.comAlso, Baxley, Jr. will be doing a presentation on his Oz books, influences, and life, will be presenting his Oz books there, including a premiere of “The Evil Emerald Village of Oz: Talking City Book II” and will be donating proceeds from his books to the L. Frank Baum Foundation the entire weekend of the event. 


 Cards and prints from the “The Evil Emerald Village of Oz” and the premiered book itself will be offered for donors at different levels as will some original artwork from the book. Sales of the book and the cards, posters, and prints through this crowd fund-raising campaign will be used for the trip. Sales during the weekend itself will be donated to the L. Frank Baum Foundation.

Cards and prints from the “The Evil and prints through this crowd fund-raising campaign will be used for the trip. Sales during the weekend itself will be donated to the L. Frank Baum Foundation. Books, cards, and prints, etc. will be offered for sale via postal mail and during the weekend of the event. (See http://www.reimannbooks.com ,http://www.lulu.com
eetatcocispress ,

Amazon.com , and CreateSpace.com and google Columbia Star and Ron Baxley for more information about Baxley and his books and previous publications)

Pacentine is a young man and small business owner, who needs assistance with the cost of his flight, hotel stay, and other expenses. Baxley, Jr. is a man close to 40 but works as a full-time English and reading instructor at a technical college and after approximately seven years receives the equivalent of a first year teacher salary in many areas. 
Both are willing to offer many fantastic items, which you will soon see, in return for a donation at different levels. Keep in mind that your donation to this near-middle-aged and young man will not only help them but will help the L. Frank Baum Foundation in fund-raising efforts and entertainment for the weekend. 


Aaron Pacentine & Ron Baxley Jr.

Note - The total amount raised will help with fronting costs for reward items, shipping, travel, lodging, and food while the Oz celebrities are providing donations of items, entertainment, and time.

(See http://www.reimannbooks.com ,http://www.lulu.comeetatcocispress , 
Amazon.com , and CreateSpace.com and google Columbia Star and Ron Baxley for more information about Baxley and his books and previous publications)Pacentine is a young man and small business owner, who needs assistance with the cost of his flight, hotel stay, and other expenses. Baxley, Jr. is a man close to 40 but works as a full-time English and reading instructor at a technical college and after approximately seven years receives the equivalent of a first year teacher salary in many areas. Both are willing to offer many fantastic items, which you will soon see, in return for a donation at different levels. Keep in mind that your donation to this near-middle-aged and young man will not only help them but will help the L. Frank Baum Foundation in fund-raising efforts and entertainment for the weekend. Aaron Pacentine & Ron Baxley Jr.
Note - The total amount raised will help with fronting costs for reward items, shipping, travel, lodging, and food while the Oz celebrities are providing donations of items, entertainment, and time.

story:
The Infinite Learning Group will serve all “at-risk” teens throughout the city of Seattle, WA. GLBT (Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual, & Transgender) homeless students, students with special needs, minority/immigrant students, teenage parents, bullied students, and students who are in the foster care system will be our main populations to serve.  Temporary housing, clothing, food, and counseling services will also be available for all students and their families.

The Infinite Learning Group focuses on the needs of our students in order to give them the skills necessary to complete their high school expectations and beyond.  Our focus is to prepare all “at-risk” and homeless youth and adults for a successful academic, personal, and professional future.

Core competencies and strengths

The main strength and core competency of The Infinite Learning Group is the skill level, certification, and knowledge of our extremely competent academic advisors (teachers).  Our advisors are masters in their field(s) of practice and study.  TILG’s advisors are not only highly educated and skilled, we individually appreciate and believe in our students and their desire to become more successful.

Our curriculum at TILG is state approved which allows school districts throughout the 50 United States to accept and confirm the completed work from our students and learning center.  Each pre and post exam, all learning lessons and exams must be “passed” with an 80% or higher.  If a student scores below the expected 80%, they have the opportunity to retake the curriculum, part or whole, until the 80% is achieved.  Our learning advisor’s work with students one-on-one or in small groups to help differentiate the needs of our students, until 100% comprehension and utilization of the material is proven verbally and in written practice.

Our long-term objectives are:  Your donations will go towards:

• Direct, explicit comprehension instruction: instruction in the strategies and processes that proficient readers use to understand what they read, including summarizing and keeping track of one’s own understanding.

• Effective instructional principles embedded in content: language arts teachers using content area texts (such as science or history) and content-area teachers providing instruction and practice in reading and writing skills specific to their subject areas.  Motivation and self-directed learning: building motivation to read and learn and providing students with the instruction and supports needed for independent learning tasks they will face after graduation.  Students can work on-site and at home, temporary housing will be available for students and their families

• Text-based collaborative learning: students interacting with one another around a variety of texts.

• Strategic tutoring: intense individualized reading, writing, and content instruction as needed.

• Diverse texts: texts at a variety of levels and on a variety of topics.

• Intensive writing: instruction connected to the kinds of writing tasks students will have to perform well in high school and beyond.

• A technology component: technology as a tool for and a topic of literacy instruction.

• Ongoing formative assessment of students: informal, often daily, assessment of how students are progressing undercurrent instructional practices.

• Extended time blocks for literacy: two to four hours of literacy instruction and practice that takes place in language arts and content-based classes.

• A comprehensive and coordinated literacy program: interdisciplinary and interdepartmental literacy activities that may even coordinate with out-of-school organizations and the local community.

• Professional development for teachers: a commitment to long-term and ongoing training for teachers.

• Ongoing summative assessment of students and programs: formal assessments that provide data for accountability and research purposes.

• Teacher teams: interdisciplinary teams that meet regularly to discuss students and align instruction.

• Informed leadership: principals and teachers with a solid understanding of how to teach reading and writing to the full array of students present in the school.

story:
Send a Farmer to a Biodynamic Conference 

My name is Amy Hamilton. I am a farmer in western NC. Throughout my life I have studied Rudolf Steiner's philosophy of Biodynamic Agriculture (BDA). When I became a full-time farmer following the birth of my son, Uriel, nearly three years ago, embracing BDA was foremost on my list. Over the past few years, as I implemented what I have learned from Steiner's Agriculture book, I realize that I would benefit greatly from studying directly with a master. This opportunity has arisen for me with the imminent arrival in the US of the Italian BDA practitioner and lecturer, Enzo Nastati. I have been awarded a partial scholarship to attend the historic seminar Sir. Nastati is giving in October 2013 in Kentucky. However, I am still in need of assistance with covering the tuition costs for the seminar and my travel costs. It is my goal to assist in the founding of a Biodynamic education facility in western NC and the seeds of this project are beginning to germinate. To this end, I hope to receive as much guidance from gifted teachers as possible, so that I may share what I learn with other farmers. I am considering myself as an ambassador-of-sorts from western NC to the KY gathering. I hope that you will assist me in this lofty goal!

To Give is To Receive

The cost of the seminar is $600.00 and covers everything. This is a break-even cost I am sure, as lodging and classes for 5 days are included in this cost.

The partial scholarship I have received through the Biodynamic Farm & Gardening Association is for $225.00.

I am still in need of $375 for tuition for the seminar and $400 for travel. My plan is to rent a car and drive to Louisville, so the $400 is for a rental car and gas only. Lodging is being provided by the host farm and I plan on bringing lots of my own BD farm-grown veggies to nourish my body and spirit during this amazing learning experience! If I do not reach my goal through this Indiegogo avenue, I will find the remaining funds somewhere! I truly believe I need to be present for this historic event. I believe it will happen somehow.

Throughout my adult life I have found myself educating and teaching others. It is something that runs in my blood (my mother and grandmother were teachers) and I thoroughly enjoy it! I am also an enthusiastic student. I graduated with a B.S. (cum laude) in 2008 from UNC-A and I have chosen to learn as much as possible from every unique work and life experience I have been blessed to receive. Learning and teaching is my gig!

Why is this so important?

If you believe that stewarding the earth is important; if you believe that farms should be truly sustainable; and if you believe that this needs to happen on a large scale immediately, then you understand that this is important. BDA offers a truly sustainable method of farming, where costs are not externalized. In my opinion, the externalization of costs is one of the main problems affecting our collective social, environmental, and financial wellbeing. At the very heart of BDA is the concept of a farm operating as an individual organism, taking and giving what it needs from itself. Even certified organic practices do not embrace this concept as fully as BDA (my farm is certified organic). Further, to bring BDA into modern times, to address our myriad modern problems, is essential to remaining relevant. Enzo Nastati has done this very thing - addressing nuclear radiation, water scarcity and quality issues, climate change (which could have potentially disastrous effects on agriculture and thus our food supply. This cannot be overstated). 

My goal in life is to operate out of hope and love, not fear and despair. I do not want to appeal to your despair, but rather your hope. I believe that it is possible to renew our ravaged Earth. I believe that it is possible to renew the connections that nourish us - connections with the blessed Earth who feeds us; connections with each other which inspire us; connections with the Divine/God/Great Spirit which bring out the very best Light within us. "This little light of mine, I'm going to let it Shine". For myself, the way that I have chosen to address the myriad problems facing the culture and society I am in is to grow food and medicine in a sustainable way. BDA offers me the opportunity to pursue a spiritual path in a practical way. Thank you for taking the time to read this and if you are moved to  contribute to this noble endeavor, I will be so grateful to you - for your belief in a renewed Earth, truly sustainable farming, and one little 5'3" farming woman in the blessed Appalachian mountains.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially, I would appreciate your support by sharing this project with others; you can participate in our BDA education in western NC; come out to help on the farm! I'm open to working with any ideas you have. Maybe you have an awesome coupon for a rental car? Let me know! And thank you so much.

story:
Здравствуйте!
Если вы находитесь на этой страничке, то скорее всего, вы:
- говорите по-русски
- интересуетесь недвижимостью в Великобритании как для собственного жилья так и для инвестирования
А для того, чтобы не прогадать с вашим первым домом, важно получить исчерпывающую информацию о том как покупать, где лучше купить, как получить кредит и многое, многое другое.

Почему людли покупают эту книгу (даже перед ее изданием)

2 недели назад я решила отослать первый черновик этой книги в электронном виде, чтобы узнать что люди на эту тему думают.

Было очень приятно получить следующую рецензию (если бы я захотела написать сама ее специально, я бы лучше не придумала, честно))

"Яна, здравствуйте!

Спасибо огромное за электронную копию книги. Мне понравился стиль написания - его простота и доступность. Также Ваши советы конкретны, чего редко встретишь в изданиях печатного формата. Учитывая стоимость книги, думаю, большинство Ваших читателей будут довольны получить электронную версию. Так что можно не заморачиваться и приступать к написанию следующей.

Очень хотелось бы познакомиться с Вашим изданием по покупке недвижимости, как инвестиции. Особенно интересуют момент получения ипотеки от банка под покупку недвижимости в аренду. А также вопрос получения дополнительного моргича уже под купленную ранее собственность. И тема – re-mortgage. В случае, когда просто хочется купить дом побольше.

К сожалению, Вашу книгу я прочла уже после того, как стала счастливым обладателем квартиры в Лондоне. Но, так как появилась возможность покупки квартиры в том же доме на нижнем уровне, все Ваши советы оказались очень вовремя. Спасибо!

Всего наилучшее и рада буду личной встрече на одном из Ваших семинаров. Пожалуйста, держите меня в курсе.

Ирина"

Кстати, первый семинар я планирую 25 апреля, так что если вы хотите забронировать место за половину цены, подписывайтесь на perk и кроме электронной книги, я вам также пришлю приглашение, как только утрясется место и время семинара.

Почему моя книга будет полезна всем
Сделки с недвижимостью, особенно в Лондоне, это очень жесткий мир и самый быстрый способ потерять кровно заработанные деньги, если совершить ошибку. А ошибок на каждой сделке можно сделать кучу. Покупатель недвижимости – самое уязвимое и беззащитное существо, которое к тому же платит по всем счетам. Так что если вы готовы заниматься недвижимостью, то надо к этому относиться серьезно и иметь железные нервы. Но изначально надо знать основы и эта книга будет первым источником такой информации.
Что будет в книге
- Когда покупать недвижимость и когда лопнет лондонский пузырь
- С чего начинать покупку недвижимости, когда у вас 10,000 под матрасом
- Как проверить ваш кредитный и ипотечный рейтинг и как их улучшить или исправить
- Как найти недвижимость своей мечты и начать переговоры по покупке
- Как поверить реальную стоимость недвижимости и методы как сбить цену
- Чем отличатся leasehold от freehold и чем это грозит покупателю
- Как выбрать советника по ипотеке и получить ипотеку
- Как убедить банк дать вам ипотеку, если вам уже отказали в кредите
- Как собрать недостающую сумму на депозит
- Какие существуют издержки связанные с покупкой недвижимости и как избежать половину из них
- Как выбрать юриста и как его контролировать, чтобы не сорвалась сделка
- Как завершить сделку и практические советы по переезду и ремонту.
- О покупке недвижимости на аукционах  ниже рыночной стоимости.

Как это будет выглядеть
Это будет серия книг, разделенные по темам.
• Выход первой книги  Март - апрель 2015
• Объем: 150 страниц
• Формат: А 5
• Распространение: Великобритания и русско-язычные страны (электронная версия)
• Тираж: 4000 экз.

story:
CLICK HERE ~ (VIDEO) Watch Matt Schwartz Story on Fox News

Most people experience struggle sometime in their life.  However, in just a few short months, single parent Matt Schwartz and his children, have experienced an unbelievable turn of events that would make most people crumble.

What Would You Do If...  

You suddenly had a child with a life threatening illness?      

You became a single parent of four children under seven years old?         

You lost your job?                                                                               

You lost your home?                                                                    

Someone rear ended you and you lost your car?                                    

You had to sell all of your family belongings just for daily living expenses?

... All At The Same Time?

Matt's Story

CLICK HERE ~ (VIDEO) Watch Matt Schwartz Story on Fox News 

November 17th, 2011 started as a joyous day for Matt Schwartz and his three children, all under 7 years old. They welcomed Matt's fourth child and new baby brother, Houston, into the world.

On that day, Matt was told that his newborn son, Houston, had a life threatening illness and within a few short weeks Matt lost his job, his home, his car and he sold most of the family belongings to pay family daily living expenses.  Matt did keep sentimental belongings, the kid’s beds and some of their toys, which are currently in storage. Thankfully, two local car dealerships got together and gave Matt a reliable car.  He would be completely lost without it.

Being a single Dad, it is virtually impossible for Matt to look for work right now.  His time is divided between his son, Houston, at Penn State Milton Hershey Medical Center and his three other young children staying at the Ronald McDonald House.  When not at the Ronald McDonald House, Matt and his children live in his mother's basement in York, Pennsylvania.   

After hearing about Matt's plight, Facebook friends and complete strangers came together to become Houston's Angels.  Our main goal is to reach out and help Matt and his family in any way possible.

Like most of us, it is difficult for Matt to ask for help, but that is what Angels are for, right?  We want to help get Matt back on his feet as he helps Houston fight for his life, while caring for his other three children. This family needs stability, which they have not had since November 2011.

CLICK HERE ~ (VIDEO) Watch Matt Schwartz Story on Fox News

CLICK HERE ~ Local News Article about Matt Schwartz and his Family

CLICK HERE ~ Local News Article about Houston's Angels

 

Matt Can NOT Do This On His Own

Since Matt lost his job and is the full-time caregiver for his 4 kids, including critically ill Houston, he needs our help.  It will be a while until Matt is able to make an income and provide for his family on his own.  We would love to take away his stress of having to worry about how to feed and house his children.

Ideally, Matt would like to rent an apartment close to Penn State Milton S. Hershey Medical Center, so he can get Houston there quickly if there is an emergency, yet still be near his other children.

Houston's Angels want to make certain that Matt has money for "everyday" living expenses and all the extra daily things necessary that mount quickly when you're not working... and that WE ALL tend to take for granted.

How Can We Help Matt?

Whether you are lucky enough to know Matt Schwartz and his family personally, or whether they are strangers to you, please give what you can to help Matt and his children through this very difficult and trying time in their lives.

Approximate Living Expenses for Matt and his children for at least 12 months...

* Apartment Rental ($9,600)

* Utilities ($4,200)

* Car Insurance ($960)

* Gas ($720)

* Cell Phone ($720)

* Child Care ($10,000+)

* Diapers ($1,000)

* Storage and Moving Expenses ($300)

* Eating only One Meal at Hospital Every day ($3,650)

* Food/Groceries for the Family ($9,600)

* School Supplies and Clothing ($600)

* Daily living expenses that we all take for granted ($3,000)

This all adds up to over $43,000! 

Ultimately, we would love to set the goal higher for Matt.  To be honest, the website takes a higher percentage if you don't reach the goal, so we decided to set it lower.  Matt and his family are so appreciative for any and all help, but please keep in mind that the goal is just a fraction of what Matt will need to care for his family for the months and years to come.

Other Ways You Can Help Matt

* In-Kind Donations:   Anyone in the Hershey/Palmyra, Pennsylvania area  could offer free rent to Matt and his kids.  Matt is a handy guy and could trade rent for handy work.  When Matt does find a home, he will need to replace all of the furniture and household goods. Contact Matt by joining Houston's Facebook page and send him a message or email randgschwartz@gmail.com

* CLICK HERE to Join the Houston Schwartz Community on Facebook to follow Houston and show your support to Matt as they continue their fight.

* As easy as one click, please use the "Share" tools above to share this campaign with family, friends, neighbors and co-workers through Facebook, Twitter, Google and email.  This simple task will make a huge difference!

* Be thankful for the health of your family. Most of us don't realize that next to LOVE... HEALTH truly is everything. 

Remember, we are all in this together and we need to do for each other while we can.

There are always people in need, but sometimes the most important things we do in life are the small gestures we make.

Every moment is precious.  Make it count.

  

*******************************************************

Houston's Story

Houston was born November 17th, 2011. Shortly after his birth, his Daddy realized he looked blue. When Houston was checked it was found there was a problem with his heart. He was flown to Penn State Milton Hershey Medical Center and given the diagnosis of TAPVR. That stands for total anomalous pulmonary venous return. Blood that would normally be oxygenated was being short circuited and Houston's little body was being deprived of that oxygen rich blood.

Within months of being born, this little fighter has had 3 open heart surgeries, 2 balloon caths and another surgery to place a feeding tube.  

Unfortunately, with this condition, the body over heals itself causing narrowing in the crucial veins in the heart.  The balloon cath surgeries placed a tiny balloon with blades on the end that went into all four veins and cleared scarring.

The feeding tube surgery placed a Mik-Key button into his tummy for feeding and a NJ for medications.  The NJ is a continual drip for formula purposes.  Having both tubes is wonderful, since Houston can get both food and medication at the same time and not have to wait for one or the other. 

Houston has multiple heart medications, extra nutrition in his formula, and a chemotherapy drug called Gleevec. The heart medications are given by syringe through a cap in his feeding tube. Each one has to be slowly given as not to overwhelm his tiny body.

The Gleevec is given twice a day and takes over an hour to administer. During that time he is also given medication to combat the nausea that is a side effect. Each dose has to be exact and is timed for depressing the syringe and the time between each dose.

This little guy is a fighter and has already beaten the odds thanks to the care and research by Matt.  Houston has a ready smile and is very alert. He has spent a good deal of his life in the hospital and anesthetized. Houston has not been bottle fed since his last trip to the hospital March 5th 2012. The family is able to hold him now, but must be very careful.

About Pulmonary Vein Stenosis

Houston Schwartz has a rare condition called Pulmonary Vein Stenosis, which causes an obstruction in the blood vessels that bring oxygen-rich blood from the lungs back to the heart.

The stenosis occurs because of abnormal cell growth, making the veins' walls thicken and narrow.

The condition frequently gets worse. As a result, the person can lose partial or total flow to vessels.

Many children with the most severe form of pulmonary vein stenosis do not survive past early childhood.

To treat the disease, doctors can widen the veins in an open-heart surgery, attempt to stretch the vessels by cardiac catheterization with balloon dilation or do a transplant to replace the lungs and the pulmonary veins. But response to surgery or catheterization is usually short-lived, and transplants come with risks including rejection of the transplanted lung and serious infection.

story:
Our Story

RYISE - Realize Youth Infinitely Self Empowered Arts and Leadership Project (Camp), is made up of incredible youth artist leaders and their adult artist and social entrepreneur mentors.  Over the years we have witnessed a common challenge; infinite potential in the youth and limited resources in many of the families to support their youth.  We offer cutting edge support to  all youth in arts, youth social entrepreneurial, and leadership development.   We provide youth with the mentors, tools and resources needed to cultivate success academically, socially, and professionally.  Our youth are given a voice and the power to shape their own arts and leadership programs.  Youth come together as leadership committees and create programs and projects for other youth and for their communities.  Even though we offer these services at a much lower cost than most other youth services, many families still are not able to send their youth to enrichment programs in the summers and after school during the fiscal school year.


The Impact

The change the world is looking for is right in front of us.  Our youth have a different way of viewing the world future's great potential.  Their ideas and visions are ground shakingly phenomenal at times, yet often go either unheard or unseen.  The youth need people who will take a stand for change and help them to build a platform to be heard and seen for the great visionaries and creative geniuses that they are.  RYISE is the platform that allows youth to realize their greatness and be empowered to manifest their amazing visions for the world in this new era. 


What We Need & What You Get

We have a long waiting list of youth desiring to get into the RYISE Arts and Leadership Camp happening July 11, 2011 and they need your support.  The camp's tuition is $800 per youth.  The tuition allows youth from low income households to have access to the high quality of enrichment activities, tools, resources, and professional mentors/facilitators that youth from affluent communities often are accustomed to. 

We have been meeting with our junior and senior youth leadership committees and they have voiced exactly what they want from their camp this year.  In order for us to support their vision and voice, we need your help.  We are helping the youth raise $30,000 for their idea camp program.  In the spirit of The 2008 Obama Presidential Campaign, we are calling on every one and every level of contribution.  Every penny counts as this is a mass movement effort.  Your small or large contribution will combine to make a great impact on these youth's lives through this empowering arts and leadership project.  


Goal:  Raise $30,000 before August 25, 2011


Anticipated Youth Attendees: 60


These funds go towards...


  • Bringing in true experts to mentor and facilitate workshops for the youth. 
  • Providing transportation and admission to enriching field trips.
  • Providing healthy foods for youth during camp.
  • Providing youth with safe and stimulating creative spaces for workshops and creative exploration.
  • Providing youth with camp uniforms.
  • Providing youth with the necessary tools, equipment, and lab materials for their workshops and projects.
  • Providing working parents with extended care hours for their youth.
  • Providing youth with the support and resources to put on a grand finale art fusion exhibition for youth from throughout the city at The RYISE 2011 Youth Arts and Leadership Exhibition


How it works:


"Pay it forward!"  There are some families that may be able to pay a portion of the tuition.  Those families contributions will also help some of the youth who's families that are not able to pay barely anything at all.  This alone will not be enough to service many of the youth on our waiting list for sponsorship.  Here's where you come in.

Sponsors



What You Give


Level 1 -       $10 - $49

Art supplies, healthy snacks, extra camp t-shirt for 1 - 3 youth.

Level 2 -       $50 - $99

Field trip transportation and admission, art supplies, musical instrument rental, costumes for 1 - 5 youth.

Level 3 -       $100 - $499

digital photography equipment, healthy lunch each day of camp, even better field trips, media arts software for 1 - 10 youth.

Level 4 -       $500 - $30,000

Camp tuition for all 1 - 60 youth,






What You Get


Level 1 Contributor:

  • You are assigned a youth and will get a special report from that youth at the                                                     conclusion of camp allowing you to witness the impact of your collective contributions 
  • Collectible rock style RYISE youth artist event button designed by our youth     

Level 2 Contributor:

  • You are assigned a youth and will get a special report from that youth at the                                                     conclusion of camp allowing you to witness the impact of your collective contributions
  • VIP pass to a secret sneak peak performance by RYISE youth artist and special guest                           performers in special appreciation of all Level 2 and Level 3 sponsors
  • Collectible rock style RYISE youth artist event button designed by our youth
  • Collectible RYISE youth artist event T-shirt designed by our youth

Level 3 Contributor:

  • You are assigned a youth and will get a special report from that youth at the                                                     conclusion of camp allowing you to witness the impact of your collective contributions
  • Honorable mentions on RYISE.org Youth Sponsor's Page
  • VIP pass to a secret sneak peak performance by RYISE youth artist and special guest performers in special appreciation of all Level 2 and Level 3 sponsors
  • Collectible rock style RYISE youth artist event button designed by our youth
  • Collectible RYISE youth artist event T-shirt designed by our youth
  • Invite to special VIP reception at 2011 RYISE Youth Arts and Leadership Exhibition

Level 4 Contributor:  

  • You are assigned a youth and will get a special report from that youth at the                                                     conclusion of camp allowing you to witness the impact of your collective contributions
  • Web link for Corporate logo and honorable mention on RYISE.org
  • Invite to special VIP reception at 2011 RYISE Youth Arts and Leadership Exhibition
  • Corporate brand recognition on print banners, posters, and flyers for                                                          2011 RYISE Youth Arts and Leadership Exhibition
  • Presentation of Certificate of Recognition at 2011 RYISE Youth Arts and Leadership Exhibition
  • Corporate brand placed on camp T-shirts for all of youth to wear

Executive Contributor:

  • Corporate brand recognition on print banners, posters, and flyers for 2011 RYISE Youth Arts and Leadership Exhibition    
  • Web link for Corporate logo and honorable mention on RYISE.org                                       
   
  • Presentation of Certificate of Recognition at 2011 RYISE Youth Arts and Leadership Exhibition

  • Corporate brand placed on camp T-shirts for all of youth to wear


We appreciate every "Level" of contribution toward our youth's empowerment.  No matter whether we hit just above or below our target goal, we will send as many youth from the waiting list as we possibly can.  So every contribution truly does count.


Other Ways You Can Help

Get your rally hats on!  You can be an instrument for change through empowering our youth.  Spread the word.  You will be surprised at how many people out there are looking for ways that they can make an impact in a young person's life.


  • Write about this in your blog and post a link.
  • Write about how you supported a group of youth on your Facebook page and post a link.
  • Tweet about how you are helping empower youth and post a link.
  • Text about how our youth need support and place the url to www.RYSE.org.
  • Mention how you are supporting the youth to colleages, friends, family, and enemies (they will try to out do you).
  • Share any ideas  you have on how we can make this campaign even more successful.

story:
Artistry of Peace means we will ignite our passionate expressions with knowing our truth of what it means to be nonviolence - the largest love, the greatest peace.

Play in the Wild! adventures invite youth to expand awareness of life through meeting the challenges within themselves and with the earth.

Chapel Hill, North Carolina, USA…June 23-July 2, 2011

Download Artistry of Peace Flyer here (PDF Format)

Click here for Play in the Wild! website

 

Our Story 

WE are three teenegers from Morocco, Congo and Venezuela living in Charlottesville, Virginia.  Our intention, or "Kuhamasisha" in Swahili, is to raise our Consciousness by learning about ourselves and how to communicate peacefully to make a better World.  

Methusela Bwiseze 

I'm 17years old and I'm from Congo, Africa.  I have been here (in the U.S.) for one year.  I 'm so ecxited to learn more about peace because some countries in Africa they lose peace.  This opportunity is good to know more about bringing peace in the world, but i need your help so I can reach this opportunity and maybe I will be helpful to my community and countries.

Salah El Hachimi

I'm 16 years old and I'm form Morocco, North Africa.  I really want to go to this camp to learn more about peace all over the world and meet with people from other countries.  I came here to U.S.A. to have a better education and to go to better schools.  I want to share what I learn with the people in my community.

Brigith Bautista

I am from Venezuela and I am 15 years old.  I am a girl that really cares about nature and the environment, peace and love.  I always try to make my dreams happen, and one of my dreams is to change this world and to make it better.  The way I want to do this is by studying in depth about it, I think Play in the Wild! is my opportunity. 

The Impact

Our purpose is to educate ourselves on how to establish peace, love, harmony and patience in our lives and share this with those around us to create a new world in which each one of us is the change.  We are youth, we are the future of our world.  By contributing to our cause you are nourishing thirsty hearts of Peace without war. (Translated from Spanish, original text below.)


Nuestro propósito es educarnos acerca establecer paz, amor, tranquilidad, paciencia en nuestras vidas para así poder enseñar a las personas que nos rodean que podemos crear un Nuevo mundo en el que cada uno de nosotros sea el protagonista. Tenga en cuenta de que somos jovenes, y que somos el futuro de nuestra tierra. Si usted contribuye a esta causa estaría alimentando a corazones con sed de Paz sin guerra.  

-Brigith Bautista


We are currently learning about Non Violent Communication (NVC) and how to integrate it into our every day lives.  Play in the Wild! offers a container to explore choices that expand our capacity to respond compassionately and cultivate nonviolence.

What We Need

We need $2,386 to attend Play in the Wild!

*$2085 covers tuition @ $695 each - this pays for 10 days of organic meals, materials (paper, markers, paints, etc.) transportation and stipend for trek leaders.

*$70 covers transportation there and back

***Since we are going with our teacher, there are a few extra costs because she has to be there two days early and stay one day late***

*$126 covers three organic meals per person @ $21 for each of the two days prior to the opening circle.

*$105 covers the extra integration night on July 2 @ $35 each

We hope to raise more than our goal to pay IndieGoGo campaign fees 

There is a 4% fee if we meet our funding goal, and a 9% fee if we do not. There may also be a 2-3% fee charged from the payment processor

Click here for how to make a tax-deductible donation of $500 or more. 


 

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Pass it on!  Please send our campaign link to as many people as possible!

2. You can donate or lend us any of the following items:

*Lightweight sleeping bag

*Sleeping pad

*Lightweight headlamp or flashlight

*Hiking boots (if new…must be at least two weeks old)

*Water shoes (Teva type sandals…a solid sole)

*Rain Jacket

Muchas Gracias


Asante

Merci

شكرا


From the bottom of our hearts we THANK YOU!

Peace, 

Brigith, Salah, Methusela and Korina
story_txt:
Artistry
of Peace means we will ignite our passionate expressions with knowing our truth
of what it means to be nonviolence - the largest love, the greatest peace.
Play in
the Wild! adventures invite youth to expand awareness of life through meeting
the challenges within themselves and with the earth.
Chapel Hill, North
Carolina, USA…June 23-July 2, 2011
Download Artistry of Peace Flyer
here (PDF Format)
Click here for Play in the Wild! website
 
Our Story 
WE are three teenegers from Morocco, Congo and Venezuela living in Charlottesville, Virginia.  Our intention, or
"Kuhamasisha" in Swahili, is to raise our Consciousness by learning
about ourselves and how to communicate peacefully to make a better World.
 
Methusela Bwiseze 
I'm 17years old and I'm from
Congo, Africa.  I have been here (in the U.S.) for one year.  I 'm so
ecxited to learn more about peace because some countries in Africa they
lose peace.  This opportunity is good to know more about bringing peace in
the world, but i need your help so I can reach this opportunity and maybe
I will be helpful to my community and countries.
Salah El Hachimi
I'm 16 years old and I'm form Morocco,
North Africa.  I really want to go to this camp to learn more about peace
all over the world and meet with people from other countries.  I came here
to U.S.A. to have a better education and to go to better schools.  I want to share what I learn with the people in my community.
Brigith Bautista
I am from Venezuela and I am 15
years old.  I am a girl that really
cares about nature and the environment, peace and love.  I always try to make my dreams happen,
and one of my dreams is to change this world and to make it better.  The way I want to do this is by
studying in depth about it, I think Play in the Wild! is my opportunity. 
The Impact











Our purpose is to educate ourselves on how to establish peace,
love, harmony and patience in our lives and share this with those around us to
create a new world in which each one of us is the change.  We are
youth, we are the future of our world.  By contributing to our cause
you are nourishing thirsty hearts of Peace without war. (Translated from Spanish, original text below.)



Nuestro propósito es educarnos acerca establecer paz, amor,
tranquilidad, paciencia en nuestras vidas para así poder enseñar a las personas
que nos rodean que podemos crear un Nuevo mundo en el que cada uno de
nosotros sea el protagonista. Tenga en cuenta de que somos jovenes, y que somos
el futuro de nuestra tierra. Si usted contribuye a esta causa estaría
alimentando a corazones con sed de Paz sin guerra.  
-Brigith Bautista

story:
(Versiòn en Español)

Summary

"It always seems impossible until it is done." - Nelson Mandela

There are over 200 million undernourished children around the world, with millions unnecessarily dying every year.  A few daily grams of spirulina, a marine organism declared by the UN as the most complete food to fight malnutrition at a global scale, will put an end to this tragedy.

The goal of our company is to apply our disruptive water-based technology to create sustainable food and energy by growing low-cost and very high-scale microalgae spirulina.  As part of our social-capitalist corporate goal, in addition to sales of product, we will distribute FREE spirulina to end child malnutrition in the world. 

We are at the point where we need to rent a warehouse, hire labour and buy industrial-scale equipment to harvest, package, store and ship very large quantities of spirulina as part of our business plan expansion. 

We are reaching out to all of you to accelerate this project, and to give everyone in the world the opportunity to claim that "I helped end child malnutrition and global hunger".  Our technology allows us to grow large quantities of protein-rich spirulina at very low cost, and in this way we can sell product to our customers at market prices, while in parallel we will have enough quantities of spirulina to distribute free to those in need, on a global basis.  This is our vision of "social-capitalism" at work!

About us

My name is Miguel Cizin.  I am 50 years old.  I am an ex-AT&T Bell Labs aerospace engineer, with an MBA in international business.  About 14 years ago, while I was the General Manager of the subsidiary of Canadian company Nortel Networks based in Israel, I met a very unique individual, an Israeli inventor, an autodidact mathematician and physicist, and a water expert: Eran Gabbai.

Eran`s father was one of the pioneers and inventors of the dripping irrigation technology for which Israel is now famous world-wide.

With such an inventive father as his mentor, Eran grew up surrounded and intrigued by water and agriculture.

Back in 1998, Eran shared with me during a boat ride his main invention and concept related to water. He described how by changing the structure of water one could use it as a technology platform similar to what nature and our own bodies do every day (think for example how ice and vapour are different arrangements of the same water molecules, in structures so unique that one has allowed us to refrigerate our foods, and the other to power a turbine to generate electricity.)  I was fascinated by it (and I still am, to this day).

I then asked Eran one simple and straightforward question: "Why did the universe gave you such a gift?", to which Eran responded: "To help the world and to make peace amongst the nations. The Arab world was given oil and paradoxically, also living in the desert, the Jews were given water as a hidden gift to the world. Water is indeed life, and if you can harness its power, you can help the entire world."

I told Eran that for some reason that I could not understand then, I, a Uruguay-born engineer, and also a citizen of the USA and Israel, would help him make that dream come true, whatever it took.  I have always seen myself as a citizen of the world, a cosmopolitan that has lived in many cities and worked within many cultures, and today I know that this is my main mission in life.

Two years ago Eran visited me in Buenos Aires, Argentina  - where I work today as the General Manager of the subsidiary of an Israeli company.  I offered him, and Eran accepted, to start a new business with me, owned 50-50 and without outside investors, since ours would become a new "social-capitalist" company. This term meant that our company would operate as a regular company in a capitalist environment, but its profits would be re-invested exclusively to do social good, and to foster peace and wealth balance, globally.

The goal of our company is to apply Eran`s invention to create sustainable food and energy by growing low-cost and very high-scale microalgae spirulina, a marine organism declared by the UN as the most complete food to fight malnutrition at a global scale. 

At a second stage, we will grow oil-rich spirulina and convert this oily biomass to truly renewable fuels.

Our plan is to put our technology to work by collaborating with governments in developing countries to create jobs, and in this way help address basic unmet social issues such as rural poverty and hunger, while exporting our products to the richer countries.  We want to help balance the wealth of nations on a global scale, while trading like any other capitalistic company.

Our first social project is to end child malnutrition globally. And we want to do it today, immediately, not in the future. With your help, we will start it now.

The challenge of ending child malnutrition

To help you quantify the magnitude of this challenge, please consider that in order to provide at least 3 grams of free spirulina on a daily basis for 200M children, which is just enough to fulfill their daily fortification needs, it will require 600 metric tons of spirulina per day, i.e. over 200,000 metric tons per year. 

However, the total ANNUAL amount of spirulina produced in all countries using the existing technologies is estimated at around just over 10,000 metric tons.  Spirulina`s retail price ranges from 50 to 150 dollars per kilo, as it is a scarce, yet valued product.  Therefore, if it was possible for companies to produce such large amounts of spirulina, the average market value of those 600 metric tons of spirulina would be about 60M US dollars (per day).

Over the past two years, we have been able to apply water structuring technology to the production of low-cost spirulina in Israel. With Eran`s technology, we enabled what we call "deep photosynthesis," similar to how nature works to allow photosynthesis even in the deepest and darkest areas of every tree in a dense forest.  Due to this effect, trees have very green leaves throughout, in spite of the fact that most of these do not have access to direct sunlight, as only the exterior leaves and especially those on the tree tops are exposed to light.

With Eran`s technology and our company`s goals, and with your help, we are ready and eager to face and win this challenge.

"If you build it, they will come." - from Field of Dreams

What We Need

Eran and I have been for the past two years self-financing and building what we are sure will be the largest spirulina producing company in the world, using our own personal resources:  knowledge, time and money.

Eran has been working without a salary for two years, and has taken personal loans from banks. I have invested all of my personal savings and monthly income to finance the operations of our company for the past two years and I plan to dedicate myself 100% to the new startup company which is ready to begin sales and must hire key operational personnel, as soon as we have suitable financing to continue our life-long project.

We are at the point where we need to rent a warehouse, hire labour and buy industrial-scale equipment to harvest, package, store and ship very large quantities of spirulina as part of our business plan expansion.

In order to continue to grow our company and realize our dream without outside investors (such as so-called angels, VCs or banks) that may not be able to help us become the type of company that we envision, it is now the moment to use another personal resource of ours, namely our network of friends and family, and people like all of you around the world.  

We need money to finance our first industrial-scale facility in Israel, where Eran lives, and then we will be able to expand to other countries by investing our own revenues from sales of spirulina to feed and food companies all over the world. 

Our plan is to continue to self-finance our growth by sales of our products and avoid outside investors.

With water structuring technology, we will be able to produce the daily 600 metric tons of spirulina - required to end child malnutrition in the world - in just a few hectares of land.  We will use the profits from sales of our spirulina production for valuable commercial products such as animal feed and human nutrition first, and renewable biofuels later on, to finance the free spirulina distribution.

The next step will be to address the remaining 600M undernourished people on the planet and end hunger on a global basis by expanding our free spirulina distribution.

What You Get

We are reaching out to all of you to accelerate this worthy project, and to give every one in the world the opportunity to claim that "I helped end child malnutrition and global hunger".

If you donate more than $5 towards this project and dream, we will include you on our Honor List in our web site. 

If you donate more than $10, once we have our headquarters building, we will inscribe your name on a plaque visible to all visitors to the building with the title: "I helped end child malnutrition in the world". 

If you donate more than $50 we will also give you a coupon of equal value towards the purchase of our spirulina products. 

Special recognition: Top individual contributors will be invited to visit our manufacturing facility in Israel and to personally sign their name on a separate, top contributor Diamond plaque that will be displayed in our future headquarters building.

CORPORATE donors will have their logo printed on our spirulina packaging, showing everyone that they supported the free spirulina distribution project.

I personally believe that 2012 was indeed an inflexion point in the history of humanity, as we began to evolve from being a divided species, and started to reach out and connect through the world wide web to become the best version of our best dream about ourselves as a global family of people and not just separate, unconnected individuals as in the past.

We hope that you may want to actively share in our dream and help us end child malnutrition, rural poverty, and the gross inequality between the southern and northern hemispheres that are the result of many years of neglect and lack of a unifying global dream.

Thanks for reading about our dream and wish us good luck!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us not only by donating money, but also by spreading the word to your network of friends and colleagues, so the campaign for this worthy project becomes viral and global, and we exceed our campaign goal and thus realize our dream even faster, for everyone`s benefit and pride.


You can use this web site`s SHARE tools to let your friends and family know about this project, and in this simple way you help us help the world !!

 

"Be the change you want to see in the world." - Mahatma Gandhi

story:
As a gesture honoring the lost lives of the Sandy Hook tragedy in Newtown CT, local filmmakers joined director Ben Proulx to create “26 Angels”, a video featuring an original song by Boston musician and Berklee College of Music alumni, Justin Cohen.

20 children, ages 12 and under, sang the song with Justin, backed by 5 other musicians, totaling 20 children and 6 adults to represent the 26 victims of Sandy Hook Elementary School.

We have decided to use this video as part of a campaign to raise funds to help design and construct a memorial park on the land formerly occupied by Sandy Hook Elementary.

The community has decided to tear down the Sandy Hook Elementary School and in it’s place they will build a memorial park where people can come to come together to mourn, to remember, and hopefully, to heal.

The “26 Angels” team in Boston is proud to have joined forces with The Richard Paul Evans organization to install a commemorative angel statue on the site. This “Christmas Box Angel” statue is part of a worldwide network of memorial angel statues erected as places for parents to go to mourn lost children. In addition to this memorial “Christmas Box Angel” statue, we can use the funds we raise in other ways to help beautify the Sandy Hook memorial. Things like memorial benches, a beautifully designed garden around the angel, a water element like a pond or fountain, a labyrinth, etc.

We have the ability to spread the reach of this video, touch people’s hearts, and allow the world to tangibly contribute towards helping the recovery of the Newtown community by helping to build this memorial park.

Please help us make this happen!

To share the video and the donation information pertaining to this initiative, please use:http://Presskit.to/26Angels or www.26AngelsTribute.com. We are encouraging people to like and share the page - the more people do that the faster we can spread the word and contribute towards this memorial park!

To connect on social media and get the latest updates about the project including behind-the-scenes production photos visit the facebook page http://www.facebook.com/26angelsvideo.

Donate as much as you can, ever dollar will help this project become an important symbol for the community of Newtown CT, if not the world. As plans continue to develop about the site, we will share with donors all of the amazing opportunities there are for us to beautify this historic site.

If you like what we’re doing, please tell your friends and spread the good word!

With utmost respect & appreciation,

- The 26 Angels video tribute team.

story:
(I do not claim any rights to this video nor to own this video, it is footage from the Salzburg Global Seminar at the conference "The Global Prevention of Genocide: Learning from the Holocaust.")

 

 

"The premier demand upon all education is that Auschwitz not happen again...Every debate about the ideals of education is trivial and inconsequential compared to this single ideal: never again Auschwitz."

Adorno, Theodor. Education after Auschwitz: 1.

 

What I'm doing

My name is Irissa and I am a student at Hampshire College in Massachusetts. Next school year I embark on my "Division III," which is a self-directed year-long project on the subject which I have been most interested in studying throughout my time at this school. My Division III will be a study of the ways the Holocaust has been represented and taught through museums.

The trip you would be funding is a seven-week program in Prague, Czech Republic and Krakow, Poland. My time in Prague will be spent learning about the historical conservation as well as history of the city and surrounding areas, enhancing my knowledge of Central Europe. I will then move to Krakow, Poland where I will be working at a premier Jewish museum, given direct access to behind-the-scenes understanding of how the Holocaust is represented to the public. I will also be visiting camps, such as Auschwitz, during my free time, as well as engaging with Holocaust academics in the area. This will be direct research for my Division III and a life-changing experience. 

I am a third-year college student and cannot really afford this program, so fundraising is crucial to my ability to continue my research and further my education. I hope to work in Holocaust museums following my graduation, so this will also get me direct experience in the field I want to pursue!

What I Need & What You Get

My program will be through the Dartmore Institue for Central European Studies based in Prague, Czech Republic. The lump sum, then, is a payment to them which covers housing, utilities, occasional group meals, tuition, and their assistance in facilitating my internship.

  • Travel to/from Prague, Czech Republic: $1,500
  • Food and Personal Expenses: $530
  • Program itself: $5,750

You might see I'm asking for less than that. I wanted to set an attainable goal that would make a dent, albeit small, in my overall monetary needs so that the trip is more feasible than it currently is. I need approximately $8,000 for this trip, and if I cannot raise that much, I will most likely need to attempt to borrow money.
My project is currently already supported by the Sander Thoenes Division III Research Award.

Gifts upon donation will be thank you letters and postcards detailing what you've helped me achieve in my time abroad. I'm also a film photography student, so the more you donate, the higher the "perks" - most likely being photographic prints from my time abroad!

How This Will Make a Difference

Holocaust education is fundamental in the postwar period. It is vital to attempt to understand what happened in Europe in the 1930s-40s, not only out of respect for those who passed, but to harbor cultures where these kinds of acts are unacceptable. The more people work to comprehend genocide methods of persecution, the more unlikely we make the continuation of these oppressive actions.

Can't Donate?

That's okay! It'd be great if you'd spread the word to family and friends who might have an interest in supporting this; and either way, thanks for reading!
story_txt:
(I do not claim any rights to this video nor to own this video, it is footage from the Salzburg Global Seminar at the conference "The Global Prevention of Genocide: Learning from the Holocaust.")
 
 
"The premier demand upon all education is that Auschwitz not happen again...Every debate about the ideals of education is trivial and inconsequential compared to this single ideal: never again Auschwitz."
Adorno, Theodor. Education after Auschwitz: 1.
 
What I'm doing
My name is Irissa and I am a student at Hampshire College in Massachusetts. Next school year I embark on my "Division III," which is a self-directed year-long project on the subject which I have been most interested in studying throughout my time at this school. My Division III will be a study of the ways the Holocaust has been represented and taught through museums.
The trip you would be funding is a seven-week program in Prague, Czech Republic and Krakow, Poland. My time in Prague will be spent learning about the historical conservation as well as history of the city and surrounding areas, enhancing my knowledge of Central Europe. I will then move to Krakow, Poland where I will be working at a premier Jewish museum, given direct access to behind-the-scenes understanding of how the Holocaust is represented to the public. I will also be visiting camps, such as Auschwitz, during my free time, as well as engaging with Holocaust academics in the area. This will be direct research for my Division III and a life-changing experience. 
I am a third-year college student and cannot really afford this program, so fundraising is crucial to my ability to continue my research and further my education. I hope to work in Holocaust museums following my graduation, so this will also get me direct experience in the field I want to pursue!


What I Need & What You Get
My program will be through the Dartmore Institue for Central European Studies based in Prague, Czech Republic. The lump sum, then, is a payment to them which covers housing, utilities, occasional group meals, tuition, and their assistance in facilitating my internship.

Travel to/from Prague, Czech Republic: $1,500
Food and Personal Expenses: $530
Program itself: $5,750

You might see I'm asking for less than that. I wanted to set an attainable goal that would make a dent, albeit small, in my overall monetary needs so that the trip is more feasible than it currently is. I need approximately $8,000 for this trip, and if I cannot raise that much, I will most likely need to attempt to borrow money.My project is currently already supported by the Sander Thoenes Division III Research Award.
Gifts upon donation will be thank you letters and postcards detailing what you've helped me achieve in my time abroad. I'm also a film photography student, so the more you donate, the higher the "perks" - most likely being photographic prints from my time abroad!


How This Will Make a Difference
Holocaust education is fundamental in the postwar period. It is vital to attempt to understand what happened in Europe in the 1930s-40s, not only out of respect for those who passed, but to harbor cultures where these kinds of acts are unacceptable. The more people work to comprehend genocide methods of persecution, the more unlikely we make the continuation of these oppressive actions.
