story:
Introduction

Hey guys, my name is James Tucker, and I am a junior in college. This July, through my school, I’ll have the privilege of traveling with a team of fellow students and faculty to China. For the majority of the trip, we will be teaching an English summer course at a university in China. 

What I Need

For the trip, each student is required to raise $2,900 in funds by sending out support letters to various individuals. This covers the airfare and all the miscellaneous expenses we'll each have while we are in China such as food. The lodging is being covered by the university we are staying at.

The reason why I have created this project is because my funds were due last week, yet I am still only at 13% support. If I don't raise the remaining $2,500 within a week, I'll most likely be taken off the team. Would you please consider supporting me? If 500 folks were to each donate $5, my goal would be reached. At this point of time, even $1 goes a long way. If I end up not reaching my goal of $2500, any funds that have contributed will be refunded back to the donors.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to support me, I totally understand. I do, however, ask for one more thing. I truly covet your prayers. One, please pray that the funds will come in, if that's what God wants. Secondly, if I make it to China, please pray that we will be able to share the good news. 

“It takes us long to learn that prayer is more important than organization, more powerful than armies, more influential than wealth and mightier than all learning.” – Samuel Chadwick

 

Please share this page wherever you can! (Facebook, Twitter, mention it to friends, etc.)

story:
The South Park JROTC Grizzlies Battalion.

The South Park Grizzlies JROTC Battalion is comprised of Cadets from all over the City of Buffalo.  Any student in the school is eligible to participate in the JROTC program.   Cadets have the opportunity to participate in several JROTC Specific events.  They can participate in and with our JROTC Drill Team, Color Guard, Joint Academic and Leadership Team.  The JROTC Battalion provides Cadets to support many of the schools extra curricular events, such as Open Houses, Orientation, Hall of Fame Induction Ceremony.  The schools color guard have been requested by local community groups, veterans organizations and others to open their events.  One of the highlights of this past year was the South Park JROTC Color Guard and Battalion Leading the Parade of Circles in South Buffalo. 

Who joins JROTC?  The program is open to all students. 

In our most recent graduating class, the class of 2012, the Grizzlies Battalion boasts having three of the top five students in the school as members of the JROTC Battalion.

The Impact

The South Park JROTC Program takes a select group of motivated Cadets to Camp Whispering Pines in the Western New York.  The camp lasts  four days and the cadets have the opportunity to apply the  leadership training they have recieved throughout the year.  They participate in team building activities that stretch them out of their comfort zones.   Cadets through this camp are exposed to an environment some may never get the opportunity to see.
 

.

story:
The Song "Don't Be A Drop-Out!"  Recorded by James Brown, August 1966 

I am Daryl Brown, the Son of James Brown, gifted musically, funky by blood and one of only two children named in his will who is a musician.  I've traveled around the world with my dad twice.  The picture shown here on Indiegogo is me playing the drums my father sent Christmas 1968.  Dad also sent a guitar which he challenged me to learn to play so that I could one day grace the stage with him, and that dream came true.  

My love for music is so intense that I would skip high school to attend Rutgers College and study music under the tutelage of Music Professors in Brunswick, NJ.  After mom and dads’ sudden transition(s), an unsuccessful musical venture, and seven long years of litigation regarding Dad’s will I lost my musical ambitions.  May 2013 the South Carolina Supreme Court remanded the case back to Aiken County stating the 2000 will is to be honored, yet nothing has been paid out to send under privileged kids and his grand kids to college.  This catalyst has sparked a torch in me to pick up and move forward and honor my father’s wishes of his last will and testament.  I’m putting on the boxing gloves and getting in the ring for the education endowment of James Brown, Mr Dynamite.  

The crusade is to raise funds to fight South Carolina to respect James Brown’s will and allow payments for education, put a few kids through college; under privileged kids until Aiken County releases funds, have the contester’s “cease and desist,” and return to my first love of writing and producing music with the Soul Generals and Sons of Funk.

Maceo, Blow Your Horn

We are asking for $90,000, below explains how we plan to utilize the funds. Our perks are designed to have people ask you questions.  As the campaign gains momentum we will add more perks, who knows what we will come up with ....


"I Feel Good Trust" KOTSE  Education:        $50,000 = 55.5%

Legal Fund:                                                $25,000 = 27.7%

Admin, Music & Perks:                               $15,000 = 16.6%


Taking it to the Bridge 

Dad being a music innovator enriched me, starting with the challenge of playing the drums and learning the guitar, private education, summer travels working for him, then international and lastly the dream of gracing the stage with my hero, the Godfather of Soul.  James Brown was the hardest working man in the industry of entertainment because he was driven to make sure kids would never be drop outs like him.  Please consider donating so that not only can I continue my father's wishes, but we can legally release his 2000 will and education trust fund "I Feel Good" from South Carolina so many other dis-enfranchised students can receive a college education.       

Whatever You Do, Make It Funky

Help us get the world out......... PLEASE, Please, please share this campaign, the more people who know about this crusade will enable us to reach our goal, we realize everyone will not be able to donate, but assisting us to go viral over the net is helping too!


Daryl Brown, Funky By Blood!  

The Son of James Brown, the God-Father of Soul

story:
Short Summary

Hellon everyone, for those who do not know me, my name is Zoe Hickson. I am a recent graduate of a Naturopathic Medical College. In this program, I received training  to become a practicing physician who practices natural medicine to evoke healing in an individual. The philosophy of natural medicne is based on six principles. However, at the core, it is treating the underlying cause and aiding the body in healing itsself. It is a four year program after you complete your undergraduate degree. I currently have my doctorate degree in naturopathic medicine. So yes I am a doctor. However, to practice in a licensed state, I need to be licensed.

I am asking for help to raise money to pay for my medical boards that will take place this August 2013 and my licensure test in October. Registration is this month and ends on May 31st. I learned of this website last night and thought this would be a great opportunity. I am a single mother of a wonderful 3 year old boy. I work part time, and attend a mentorship. I am doing all that I can to raise money so that I can achieve my goals of becoming a Connecticut licensed healer and helping people. I have started my business and have began consulting in other states. However, until I take the clinical boards, I am unable to devote as much time to my practice for it to be lucrative. More recently, I have had to become more creative in taking care of my basics, as I am sure many people have in todays economy. I am a praying woman and will continue to, and work diligently to do my part. I am a woman of faith and know that no matter what, God will provide. I'm not sure what ways God will use, but I know it will happen.


The money will be used for my 3 day test  ($750) in August, my licensure ($565) in October, test materials such as flash cards ($130) and study questions ($90), and some living expenses, as I will not be able to work as much due to studying for 3 months. All donations are welcome and very much appreciated. If I can reach past my goal, that would be awesome, so that I can donate more of my time with health consultations for those in need. I am humbled to ask of your help, and truly honored to receive it. Any extra money will go towards providing  health consultations and supplements to those who cannot afford it, and aid them in their journey towards a healthier life.

I hope that you all can be excited with me when I receive my passing grade. Once I pass, I will take my jurisprudence test for the state of CT and receive my license. Being a doctor has been a goal of mine since I was 5 years old. Ever since that day I have worked towards that goal. ( four years of undergrad, 5 years of medical school- it took me a little longer because I had my son in my third year of medical school). Despite hard times and life throwing many curve balls, I stood steadfast and did not quit or give up. I believe in perseverance and hardwork. I also believe in being humble enough to ask for help.

Below are some websites to give you more information about naturopathic medicine and my test. Everything is legit, and quite informative.  Thank you for your time and contributions. Please feel free to email me as well if need be. I am happy to answer any questions and share more of my story and my goals as a healer. If you are unable to contribute, please feel free to pass this information along.

naturopathic.org

ct.gov/dhp

nabne.org

naturallifewellness@yahoo.com

naturallifewellnessllc.com

Blessings :),

Zoe Hickson

story:
Hi, I'm Spencer. I am raising money to go to a summer studies program this summer.  Please help with anything that you can.  Every little bit helps.  I have been successful with my offline efforts at raising money, so I just need to raise $445 to finish paying for my program.  Big thanks to everyone who has contributed so far!   I really appreciate it!

--Spencer

story:
Modafusion is a Brazilian association which exists since seven years, and which has been created by the French Nadine Gonzalez and the Brazilian Andrea Fasanello.

Nadine was a journalist and fashion consultant in Paris and Copenhagen before discovering a different way of seeing and feeling fashion in Rio de Janeiro (Brazil). Firstly sensible to the intimacy between the body and the clothe, she perceived the human and ethical side to fashion which could bring something different to a more positive economy. She started working on social projects with her brazilian partner, Andrea Fasanello, enhancing the creativity of women such as prostitutes, favela designers, prisonners, giving them exposure thanks to collections which seduced women such as Sarah Lerfel (2008/Art director of Colette Concept Store/Paris) or Carla Bruni (2009/Ex-France first lady).

ModaFusion counts not only on women but also on the youth, to hear the favelas inhabitants’ cry. With the « Générations » collections, ModaFusion teaches the youngest about history, tradition, controversials of their country thanks to an artistic interpretation unveiling young talents. A partner of Lente dos Sonhos, a model school and agency in the City of Gods, Nadine launched several young women from the community in an international modeling carrier. Nadine has been president of the ModaFusion association for 6 years since 2006, and she is a dynamic and visionary woman. With a 7 year experience of intense implication in the social and environmental areas, she acquired a rare competence, that of talking the western countries’ language as well as the community language, which grants her a precious added value, the perfect one to develop and coordinate the CFL.

Nadine wants to allow these young talents of Rio de Janeiro, not only to socially blend into the “Marvellous City » as carioca citizens, but also to find their place on the jobmarket as professional cariocas.

What we need ? 

1.       Material for our trainees:

- 10 measuring tapes 1.50

- 10 flexible rulers 30cm

- 10 flexible rulers 50cm

- 10 flats metal ruler 1m

- 10L square

- 10 compass

- 10 tracing wheels

- 10 piercer points

- 10 pairs of scissors for paper cutting

- 10 rolls of invisible scotch tapes

- 10 boxes of fine pins

- 20 or 30 pattern weights

- Pencils

- 10 erasers and 10 erasers pencil

- 10 pencils sharpener

- 10 stenciled rulers

- 150 meters of thread

- 8 kg of knit

 2.       Material for trainers:

-   One computer Mac Book Pro (will be used by each trainer and trainee, in order to learn how to draw with graphic tablet)

-  Retro projector

-  50% of trainers' salaries for one formation (100 hours)

Our aim is to get 4 500 Dollars  to buy all that we need.

Impact

1)      Generate independent income opportunities for economically and educationally disadvantaged young people (men and women) in Rio de Janeiro through fashion courses and creation

2)      Promote young favelas talents, arrise creation and creativity, despite a lack of graduations.

3)      Remove barriers to women accessing employment and education opportunities

4)      30 people trained by professional designers and fashion consultants each year

Even if courses are focused on fashion, they will help people thinking of the creation of entreprenership projects in whole art field.

Others ways to help ?

If you want to help us by another way, you can promote our project through websites, blogs, and others media.

Just sharing our project on Facebook will help us !
story_txt:
Modafusion is a Brazilian association which exists since seven years, and which has been created by the French Nadine Gonzalez and the Brazilian Andrea Fasanello.
Nadine was a journalist and fashion consultant in Paris and Copenhagen before discovering a different way of seeing and feeling fashion in Rio de Janeiro (Brazil). Firstly sensible to the intimacy between the body and the clothe, she perceived the human and ethical side to fashion which could bring something different to a more positive economy. She started working on social projects with her brazilian partner, Andrea Fasanello, enhancing the creativity of women such as prostitutes, favela designers, prisonners, giving them exposure thanks to collections which seduced women such as Sarah Lerfel (2008/Art director of Colette Concept Store/Paris) or Carla Bruni (2009/Ex-France first lady).
ModaFusion counts not only on women but also on the youth, to hear the favelas inhabitants’ cry. With the « Générations » collections, ModaFusion teaches the youngest about history, tradition, controversials of their country thanks to an artistic interpretation unveiling young talents. A partner of Lente dos Sonhos, a model school and agency in the City of Gods, Nadine launched several young women from the community in an international modeling carrier. Nadine has been president of the ModaFusion association for 6 years since 2006, and she is a dynamic and visionary woman. With a 7 year experience of intense implication in the social and environmental areas, she acquired a rare competence, that of talking the western countries’ language as well as the community language, which grants her a precious added value, the perfect one to develop and coordinate the CFL.
Nadine wants to allow these young talents of Rio de Janeiro, not only to socially blend into the “Marvellous City » as carioca citizens, but also to find their place on the jobmarket as professional cariocas.
What we need ? 
1.       Material for our trainees:
- 10 measuring tapes 1.50
- 10 flexible rulers 30cm
- 10 flexible rulers 50cm
- 10 flats metal ruler 1m
- 10L square
- 10 compass
- 10 tracing wheels
- 10 piercer points
- 10 pairs of scissors for paper cutting
- 10 rolls of invisible scotch tapes
- 10 boxes of fine pins
- 20 or 30 pattern weights
- Pencils
- 10 erasers and 10 erasers pencil
- 10 pencils sharpener
- 10 stenciled rulers
- 150 meters of thread
- 8 kg of knit
 2.       Material for trainers:
-   One computer Mac Book Pro (will be used by each trainer and trainee, in order to learn how to draw with graphic tablet)
-  Retro projector
-  50% of trainers' salaries for one formation (100 hours) 
Our aim is to get 4 500 Dollars  to buy all that we need.


Impact
1)      Generate independent income opportunities for economically and educationally disadvantaged young people (men and women) in Rio de Janeiro through fashion courses and creation
2)      Promote young favelas talents, arrise creation and creativity, despite a lack of graduations.
3)      Remove barriers to women accessing employment and education opportunities
4)      30 people trained by professional designers and fashion consultants each year
Even if courses are focused on fashion, they will help people thinking of the creation of entreprenership projects in whole art field.


Others ways to help ?
If you want to help us by another way, you can promote our project through websites, blogs, and others media.
Just sharing our project on Facebook will help us !

story:
Ozark Family Resource Agency works with abused children.  Specially trained interviewers talk to children referred by law enforcement, child protective services, and allied professionals, concerning allegations of sexual abuse, physical abuse, and neglect.   Our only focus is the Children!   The child advocacy center operates with a "Child First" advocacy, which means we endeavor to make the child as comfortable as possible in a warm, nurturing environment when discussing, sometimes, the most traumatic event that has ever happened to them.  It is seldom a stranger who abuses them, but, more likely, a family member or a person known to them.  Talking about child abuse is difficult, but nothing compared to what a child experiences.  We deal with children  aged 2 to 17, and doing this work is challenging.  We have a great volunteer who works with the kids- a specially trained black lab named Simon.   As you see in the video, he is there for the children- to talk to, play with, offer support, and give unconditional love.  When a child is crying, he gently puts his head in their lap or nuzzles their hand to be petted.  For those of us working with these kids and experiencing vicarious trauma from the children's abuse, Simon's presence is equally reaffirming.  He receives lots of hugs and kisses!  Simon is now participating in an inaugural, ground-breaking research grant through the University of Missouri and National Institute of Health to document his interaction with these most vulnerable of victims. 
Our focus is, and always has been, on the children, their needs and healing.  We collaborate with a multidisciplinary team that strives to hold the perpetrators of child abuse accountable.  We don't find ourselves looking at our building; we don't think about the roof, about the outside exterior because we are too busy helping broken children.  
Our roof is beyond repair, it is over 30 years old.   We have patched it several times, and it still leaks a steady stream into the children's waiting room/playroom.  Now there are numerous kitchen trashcans placed strategically to catch the rainwater.  The bowed ceiling is a serious safety concern.  As a non-profit, we simply do not have the money for a new roof.  Patching it is not working anymore.  Please help us fix our roof, paint our building and make the room safe and welcoming for the children to play in. Thank you for your support!!


Make a difference in a life of a child.  Childhood is a precious time.   We are working diligently to make sure that children know that someone cares and that tomorrow can be a better day.   Learn more about us at www.ofra.org.

story:
12 HOURS LEFT!!! DO IT NOW!!

OUR GOAL:

With your help, we want to raise $12,500 in 30 days to buy and donate 30 iPads to the Los Angeles Boy & Girls Club. 

WHY: 

We believe everyone should be given the opportunity to play and create music. From our experience since launching the Fingertip Maestro music application in October 2013, this is not always the case. 

After launching the app we started doing in-person demos at schools and youth organizations around the Los Angeles area, we wanted to show the kids what we created.

        $12,500 / 30 Tablets

     


WHAT IS FINGERTIP MAESTRO?

Fingertip Maestro is a revolutionary music-making app for people of all ages and abilities. From children to adults. The app enables those with no musical training, to instantly play convincingly, with the feeling and texture of a real musician. 

Just Tap, Slide & Play!

FREE for iPhone and iPad. 

https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/fingertip-maestro/id670049478?ls=1&mt=8 

WHY WE ARE HERE:

We came to the Los Angeles Boys and Girls to get feedback from the kids and see if they liked what we developed. The feedback was amazing and the Kids really helped us make Fingertip Maestro what it is today. 

      But there is a problem!



            The Los Angeles Boys and Girls club 

          does not have access to digital tablets. 


Once we finished our demo, we packed up our expensive tablets and headed for the exits. This really made us upset. We knew we needed to do something. 

That day we decided as a company to purchase an iPad and go back and donate it to the Los Angeles Boys and Girls Club, however, we are just a startup and could only afford to give them one but we knew we could do more. 

After donating one iPad and seeing the kids faces light up made us realize this is more than just a fun music app. We believe in the merit of our app, and we want to share that with more kids. Moreover, we want to give them the experience of having a technological platform, like an educational tablet at their disposal to learn from. 

   We are reaching out to you for help!


Please help us donate 30 tablets to the Los Angeles Boys and Girls Club 


     But this is just the start!



OUR STRETCH GOALS:

There are other organizations and programs we have been working with, and with your help we can surpass our 1st goal of $12,500, and raise an addition $25,000 to purchase and donate 60 more tablets to the organizations below. Let's get 60 more!!!


       $37,500 / 60 tablets 


              20 Tablets / 


             15 Tablets /   


             15 Tablets /  



            10 Tablets /  



WHO ARE THESE ORGANIZATIONS?



                                                                                    copyright: wongway_films 

LOS ANGELES BOY AND GIRLS CLUB OF AMERICA 

http://www.labgc.org/ 

For over 60 years, the Los Angeles Boys & Girls Club has accomplished its goals of opening doors and transforming lives by providing a safe place where young people can be themselves, be proud, and experience opportunities never thought possible.  Through programs that expand horizons, the Club challenges youth to experience the world outside their doorsteps and gives them the tools to succeed.


               

BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB OF VENICE 

http://bgcv.publishpath.com/ 

The Boys & Girls Clubs of Venice’s mission is to enable all young people, especially those who need us most, to reach their full potential as productive, caring, responsible citizens. The Club was established as a VISTA project on Venice Beach in 1967 and began providing services the following year. Since then we have grown significantly. Today we operate five facilities - our main facility, the James A. Collins Unit, and four satellite sites on the campuses of Coeur d’Alene Elementary School, Short Avenue Elementary School, Mark Twain Middle School, and Venice High School. This year we are expanding our programming to Hamilton High School through a partnership with the JK Living Foundation.


                         


CITY OF HOPE 

http://www.cityofhope.org/ 

City of Hope is dedicated to making a difference in the lives of people with cancer, diabetes and other serious illnesses. Our mission is to transform the future of health care by turning science into a practical benefit, hope into reality. We accomplish this by providing outstanding care, conducting innovative research and offering vital education programs focused on eliminating these diseases.

City of Hope continues to be a pioneer of patient centered care and remains committed to its tradition of exceptional care for patients, families and communities. Each day, we live out our credo:

"There is no profit in curing the body, if, in the process, we destroy the soul."


                       


SCHOOL ON WHEELS - SKIDROW LEARNING CENTER 

http://www.schoolonwheels.org/ 

School on Wheels, Inc. is a non-profit, 501(c)(3) organization founded in 1993 by Agnes Stevens, a retired teacher. After reading Jonathan Kozol’s Rachel and her Children, Agnes realized the extent of homelessness in the USA. She began tutoring homeless kids in a park in Santa Monica, encouraging them to stay in school and participate in school activities.



                  


TODAY'S FUTURE SOUND 

http://www.todaysfuturesound.org/ 

At Today’s Future Sound, we believe in the power of music to transform and inspire youth to create positive change in their lives and communities. We view our work as having educational, therapeutic and social components that can empower individuals to build confidence, inspire creativity, and create change. Today’s Future Sound (TFS) has a team of volunteers ready to bring our mobile music production and DJ’ing center to you—schools, community centers and events. We are rapid-deploying, fully mobile, and can teach all ages groups with no previous experience required. 



WHAT YOUR DONATION WILL BE USED FOR:

We will use your wonderful donations to purchase and donate tablets for the organizations listed above. We are allotting $400 per tablet to cover tablet, expenses, tax, and accessories, like headphones and covers.


EVEN BIGGER STRETCH GOALS?

Why not! Lets aim even higher! Sky's the limit. We have even more organizations and kids that can benefit from this campaign so maybe we can push past $37,500 and start another stretch goal. But first lets tackle this one! if you would like to be a part of the next stretch goal, please email us. info@fingertipmaestro.com


     THANK YOU SO MUCH!



CHECK OUT SOME OF OUR AWESOME FRIENDS:



THE TEAM:

Mark Okoh: @okeycokey

Music-producer Mark Okoh first got into music having been a professional photographer, shooting the likes of Alicia Keys, Amy Winehouse, LeAnne Rimes, and rapper Lil Jon. After seeing musicians at work he started producing music himself, which resulted in his club hit "Let Me See Your Hands" in 2010. He continues to write and produce, and while also developing his first app “Fingertip Maestro”. 

Marcin Teodoru: @marcinteodoru

Marcin Teodoru has been an entrepreneur working in the tech and entertainment industry for the last 14 years. Founder of Lucid Lab Technology, a Los Angeles based mobile app development company. Marcin has always wanted to bring together his love of music and technology. After meeting Mark at a Tech event, the two partnered up to develop “Fingertip Maestro”.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:


Please spread the word! 

Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/FingertipMaestro 

Twitter - https://twitter.com/fingertipapp  

Instagram - http://instagram.com/fingertipmaestro 

Please share with everyone you know. Only with your help and support can we make this a huge success! 

SHARE, SHARE, SHARE!!!  :) 

#fingertipapp    #fingertipmaestro

Thanks. :)

story:
THANK YOU FOR MAKING IT HAPPEN!

A million thank you's to everyone who contributed to allow me to attend this program. Because of you, I can now do something that I could never do before. I will in turn make as much impact from the program as I can.  

Exceptionally Special Thanks Go To Sponsors:

God Status:                              Lynn Wellner


Demi-God Status:            David Chappell
                                        Donald Chappell

High Honor Donors:        Edward Rosenthal
                                        Joan Gauche
                                        Roberto Veneziani
                                        Deva Chappell
                                        Thor Deegan
                                        Karen Bradley
                                        Lewis Rudolph

All Honored Donors-- Thank you, thank you, thank you for your investment and for carrying this campaign

All Ukulele Supporters-- This particularly means a lot to me because it means you have supported me regardless of talent

All Other Supporters-- Thank you, thank you, thank you for making up the difference. These campaigns are powered by you and your consideration. 
                                         


The Deal

Please support me in attending The Social Innovation Program at George Mason Center for Social Entrepreneurship to bring creative, sustainable social solutions to public education and youth services in Western Massachusetts.

ME

I am a Masters of Education student at the University of Massachusetts-Amherst studying to become a school counselor and school administrator. The field of education needs leaders who understand how to effectively and creatively use resources, network services, and meet the needs of every student. We need practical yet visionary methods to create lasting and systemic change now. This program will teach me these methods so that I may become such a leader and teach others to be as well.

THE WHY 

This training would enable me to help the struggling rural communities in my home region. I grew up and have lived most of my life in Western Massachusetts where I have witnessed the cyclical effects of rural poverty such as high drug use, youth homelessness, and sexual abuse generation after generation. Visiting elementary schools, I see the impact in young children including low self-regulation, destructive behaviors, psychological trauma, isolation from the larger world, and little sense of opportunity or personal strength. These children become the older youth I see skipping school to vandalize property who then become the addicted and abusive parents raising their children in the same chaos. We need to infuse national connections and resources into these frequently-isolated areas to more successfully pull youth out of poverty and change the trajectory of these towns’ futures.

THE HOW 

Working for nonprofits and service organizations, I have also observed how their reach is often stunted by limited funding and lack of business knowledge, particularly during these difficult economic times. Social Entrepreneurship addresses these issues through a collaborative model that combines management and capacity-building with creative and sustainable use of existing resources. Instead of depending on philanthropy and outside funding, social entrepreneurship strengthens organizations and enables them to use available resources in a self-sustaining way in order to provide for themselves. There are plenty of people interested in changing the world, but for meaningful change to occur we must collaborate, apply creative community-based systems, and take advantage of innovations in every arena, particularly business.

The Social Innovation Program at the George Mason Center for Social Entrepreneurship at George Mason University is an intensive, five-week program training participants to be social entrepreneurship consultants to businesses. Students work in small teams to apply their skills in development projects in organizations in the Greater D.C. area and rural Virginia, while simultaneously learning basic social entrepreneurship tenets and topics like effective assessment, resource management, and current innovative techniques. Students are exposed to a network of established nonprofit leaders, organizations, and national scholars in the change-making field. Students leave the program with the experience and training to provide organizational improvement and initiatives in their own communities. More information is available here.

THE VISION

I plan to share my experience, new knowledge, and skills with the University of Massachusetts faculty and students as well as with local nonprofits I am connected with such as the Full Frame Initiative, Big Brothers/Big Sisters, and requesting organizations. As a representative of my community I can widen the reach of the training to professors, community organizations, and future teachers and leaders, all of whom will in turn influence their own wide audiences.

Further, if administrators and teachers are trained in the social entrepreneurship model, they can pass it on to their students, establishing a new generation of young people who will enter society knowledgeable in conceiving and executing practical, creative, and sustainable solutions for the problems of today and tomorrow. 

What I Need & What You Get

You can contribute any dollar amount you want and I will send you rewards for crossing certain thresholds. I will share information I learn with contributors and networking organizations through update letters, stories, outlines, pamphlets, handbooks, and presentation materials. I am also offering in-person trainings and consulting hours in exchange for funding.

The goal of $2100 covers about two thirds of the tuition costs to attend the program. This includes housing, professional training and workshops, speakers, and program materials. 

It is possible for contributions toward tuition to be tax-deductible. Please contact me if you are interested. 

If I were to exceed the $2100 goal, funds would be applied in the following order: 

- $350 to cover the initial SIP deposit and IndieGoGo fees
- $300 for travel expenses to and from the program
- $400 for food during the program (budget recommended by GMCSE)
- Purchasing an up-to-date laptop for the program and upcoming school year
- Professional development fund for School Counseling conferences, education trainings, Brain Gym training, and relevant certification costs. 

Note for Local Organizations: Bringing this training back to my community means you. I would very much like to connect with you, regardless of donation size, on how to best apply these resources in your community to improve reach and strength of services. Sponsorship comes with active networking opportunities with national and D.C. organizations as well as marketing and exposure options. 

Thank you for your support and this opportunity for training to be a more effective educator and leader in my community. 

 Other Ways You Can Help

- Share personally: Share with someone via email or in person with a personal note saying "I thought you would be interested in this, please consider contributing." People are much more likely to contribute if the have been personally connected to the project. 

- Email an organization: Share with an organization you know to suggest they check out the internship offer. I can provide consulting hours virtually. 

- Share on social media: Facebook, twitter, blog-- the more people reached the more likely this campaign is to succeed. If you know me personally, give a recommendation based on what you know of my qualifications and capabilities. Thank you!
story_txt:
THANK YOU FOR MAKING IT HAPPEN!A million thank you's to everyone who contributed to allow me to attend this program. Because of you, I can now do something that I could never do before. I will in turn make as much impact from the program as I can.  Exceptionally Special Thanks Go To Sponsors:
God Status:                              Lynn Wellner

Demi-God Status:            David Chappell                                        Donald ChappellHigh Honor Donors:        Edward Rosenthal                                        Joan Gauche                                        Roberto Veneziani                                        Deva Chappell                                        Thor Deegan                                        Karen Bradley                                        Lewis RudolphAll Honored Donors-- Thank you, thank you, thank you for your investment and for carrying this campaignAll Ukulele Supporters-- This particularly means a lot to me because it means you have supported me regardless of talentAll Other Supporters-- Thank you, thank you, thank you for making up the difference. These campaigns are powered by you and your consideration.                                          

The Deal
Please support me in attending The Social Innovation Program at George Mason Center for Social Entrepreneurship to bring creative, sustainable social solutions to public education and youth services in Western Massachusetts.
ME
I am a Masters of Education student at the University of Massachusetts-Amherst studying to become a school counselor and school administrator. The field of education needs leaders who understand how to effectively and creatively use resources, network services, and meet the needs of every student. We need practical yet visionary methods to create lasting and systemic change now. This program will teach me these methods so that I may become such a leader and teach others to be as well.

THE WHY 
This training would enable me to help the struggling rural communities in my home region. I grew up and have lived most of my life in Western Massachusetts where I have witnessed the cyclical effects of rural poverty such as high drug use, youth homelessness, and sexual abuse generation after generation. Visiting elementary schools, I see the impact in young children including low self-regulation, destructive behaviors, psychological trauma, isolation from the larger world, and little sense of opportunity or personal strength. These children become the older youth I see skipping school to vandalize property who then become the addicted and abusive parents raising their children in the same chaos. We need to infuse national connections and resources into these frequently-isolated areas to more successfully pull youth out of poverty and change the trajectory of these towns’ futures.

THE HOW 
Working for nonprofits and service organizations, I have also observed how their reach is often stunted by limited funding and lack of business knowledge, particularly during these difficult economic times. Social Entrepreneurship addresses these issues through a collaborative model that combines management and capacity-building with creative and sustainable use of existing resources. Instead of depending on philanthropy and outside funding, social entrepreneurship strengthens organizations and enables them to use available resources in a self-sustaining way in order to provide for themselves. There are plenty of people interested in changing the world, but for meaningful change to occur we must collaborate, apply creative community-based systems, and take advantage of innovations in every arena, particularly business.
The Social Innovation Program at the George Mason Center for Social Entrepreneurship at George Mason University is an intensive, five-week program training participants to be social entrepreneurship consultants to businesses. Students work in small teams to apply their skills in development projects in organizations in the Greater D.C. area and rural Virginia, while simultaneously learning basic social entrepreneurship tenets and topics like effective assessment, resource management, and current innovative techniques. Students are exposed to a network of established nonprofit leaders, organizations, and national scholars in the change-making field. Students leave the program with the experience and training to provide organizational improvement and initiatives in their own communities. More information is available here.
THE VISION
I plan to share my experience, new knowledge, and skills with the University of Massachusetts faculty and students as well as with local nonprofits I am connected with such as the Full Frame Initiative, Big Brothers/Big Sisters, and requesting organizations. As a representative of my community I can widen the reach of the training to professors, community organizations, and future teachers and leaders, all of whom will in turn influence their own wide audiences.
Further, if administrators and teachers are trained in the social entrepreneurship model, they can pass it on to their students, establishing a new generation of young people who will enter society knowledgeable in conceiving and executing practical, creative, and sustainable solutions for the problems of today and tomorrow. 
What I Need & What You Get
You can contribute any dollar amount you want and I will send you rewards for crossing certain thresholds. I will share information I learn with contributors and networking organizations through update letters, stories, outlines, pamphlets, handbooks, and presentation materials. I am also offering in-person trainings and consulting hours in exchange for funding.
The goal of $2100 covers about two thirds of the tuition costs to attend the program. This includes housing, professional training and workshops, speakers, and program materials. 
It is possible for contributions toward tuition to be tax-deductible. Please contact me if you are interested.  If I were to exceed the $2100 goal, funds would be applied in the following order:  - $350 to cover the initial SIP deposit and IndieGoGo fees - $300 for travel expenses to and from the program - $400 for food during the program (budget recommended by GMCSE) - Purchasing an up-to-date laptop for the program and upcoming school year - Professional development fund for School Counseling conferences, education trainings, Brain Gym training, and relevant certification costs. 
Note for Local Organizations: Bringing this training back to my community means you. I would very much like to connect with you, regardless of donation size, on how to best apply these resources in your community to improve reach and strength of services. Sponsorship comes with active networking opportunities with national and D.C. organizations as well as marketing and exposure options. 
Thank you for your support and this opportunity for training to be a more effective educator and leader in my community. 
 Other Ways You Can Help

- Share personally: Share with someone via email or in person with a personal note saying "I thought you would be interested in this, please consider contributing." People are much more likely to contribute if the have been personally connected to the project. 
- Email an organization: Share with an organization you know to suggest they check out the internship offer. I can provide consulting hours virtually. 
- Share on social media: Facebook, twitter, blog-- the more people reached the more likely this campaign is to succeed. If you know me personally, give a recommendation based on what you know of my qualifications and capabilities. Thank you!

story:
As the largest College Republican Club in California, and previous Chapter of the Year in 2014, We need your help in funding our trip for 25 students to attend the California College Republicans Convention. Help restore America's future by investing in its youth. 

Attending the California College Republican Convention is a great learning opportunity for the student members of the Channel Islands College Republicans to learn about California Politics. Not only does the convention provide a learning experience, it also provides a networking experience for the future workforce of America. The opportunities for the members of Channel Islands College Republicans are endless. Attending the California College Republican convention this spring is another stepping stone in the lives of these 25+ college students. 

What makes us different from other College Republican Clubs?

We are one of the largest, most active chapters in the state. We strive to bring all our active members to the conventions we attend. From the new freshman student who joined the club to make friends, to the senior political science major hoping to gain work experience, this club offers every student at California State University - Channel Islands the opportunity to grow as an individual and realize what they want to do in their lives. Our legacy as a club extends further into the state and even nationally. Former board members have held jobs with California Republican Party and the College Republican National Committee. As a member of the Channel Islands College Republicans, there are endless opportunities for our members.

story:
About the Exhibit

In February, after five years of research and planning, the Children’s Museum of Manhattan (CMOM) will open America to Zanzibar: Muslim Cultures Near and Far, a groundbreaking new exhibit for families. America to Zanzibar will explore the beauty, diversity and unity of Muslim cultures around the world, from New York City to Zanzibar, and beyond. Visitors to the exhibit will be transported to over 50 locations around the world as they explore, touch, smell, listen, play and pretend. Children will be able to climb aboard an Indian Ocean Dhow Boat, listen to Joha the Jokester’s stories, play dress-up, “shop” in a souk, and so much more. In short, this exhibit is going to be AWESOME!

Concept design for the Architecture Area of the exhibit, courtesy of MIIM Designs.


Concept design for a market stall in the exhibit, highlighting Senegalese fashion.

Why We Need YOU: the 1,000 Voices Campaign

America to Zanzibar is part of CMOM’s vital mission to nurture the next generation of creative and culturally literate global citizens. The exhibit will expose families to new worlds, promote meaningful cross-cultural exchange and understanding, and have a positive impact on how the next generation of Americans interacts with Muslims both at home and globally.

Over the last five years, with the help of some very prestigious and generous donors, CMOM has invested $1 million into researching and planning for this exhibition. We hired advisers, attended conferences, consulted with experts, and even traveled to Abu Dhabi. Now, with only a few months left to go, we need to raise enough to make our vision a reality—to turn our plans and designs into a real, living exhibit for children and families everywhere to enjoy.


Families participating in CMOM's Muslim Arts Festivals leading up to the exhibit.

Our goal is to have 1,000 committed individuals make a donation to this important cause. Together, with 1,000 voices, we make this exhibit sensational. Join the chorus.

For more detailed information about the exhibit, click here to download the exhibit overview, or visit the 1,000 Voices page on CMOM’s website here.

story:
Update: Thank you for your help. The giving can continue on our website!

What is The Fieldhouse?


Merging education, athletics, and community development, The Fieldhouse is a space designed to promote the value of scholarship, foster personal growth, and facilitate economic empowerment. Part classroom, part community center, and part athletic complex, it will serve not only as the center for a reintegration-to-education program for child laborers - facilitated by our partner organization, The Cheerful Hearts Foundation - but also as a classroom and sports center shared by six local primary schools in Nyanyano, Ghana. 

The Fieldhouse is a dedicated means of support for children and families to escape cycles of poverty. The Fieldhouse programs will foster inclusivity, healthy competition, recreation, and academic scholarship. In addition to the reintegration program, Cheerful Hearts will host awareness seminars about education, personal finance workshops, and public health seminars on disease prevention and reproductive health resources available to the community.

The Impact

  • At the outset, 120 transitioning child laborers will have a space to seek support and mentorship as they transition back into the school system. 
  • When schools begin using the facility, over 500 kids will enjoy daily recess at The Fieldhouse. We estimate 200 kids will play in the soccer league. 
  • A key goal is to make the school system a more compelling alternative to activities that perpetuate a cycle of poverty.
  • Over time we will measure impact on enrollment rates, completion rates, attendance, and more in order to understand how The Fieldhouse impacts the community with a goal of positive change across all of these metrics. 

What We Need

With your help, we can raise over $5000 towards the locally-sourced construction materials, the labor of local construction workers, and all of the school and sports supplies essential to making the Fieldhouse the best resource it can be. 


Other Ways To Give

  • Want to support but don't need a reward? Click here to give online
  • Tell your friends and family about The Fieldhouse Project
  • Spread the word and engage with us on Facebook and Twitter!
  • Give a prize to for this campaign; it can be a item or a unique experience
  • Share a story about how sports impact you to info@fieldhouseproject.org

About The Fieldhouse Project

The Fieldhouse Project is a cooperative of university students lending our individual talents to make education accessible and feasible in disenfranchised communities. In July of 2013, we started this Seattle-based nonprofit with a mission to use the powers of organized athletics for community development and economic empowerment in impoverished areas.  Learn more about our team and advisory board here. 

Perks of Supporting

Fieldhouse Project
Pitch Book ($35)
T-Shirt ($50)
Patron ($1,000)

Special: Ghanian Bracelet $30


Strideline Socks - Seatown $15


Commissioned work by Isabel Klein


Signed Obafemi Martins Photograph

Signed photo of Seattle Sounders' star player. 


Screen prints by Mike Klay


15"X25" 3 color screen print w/ metallic varnish overprint - out of 100
Printed on French Speckletone Starch Rain -  $50

Olympic National Park Print. 25"X9.5" 3-color screen print - $40


From Ghana
Note ($10)
Bracelet ($30)
Painting ($150)
Mask ($200+)

Construction
Early Adopter Brick ($100)
Buy a Brick ($200)
Fund Solar Power ($2,000)
Fund a Field ($5,000)
Want to support something else? Contact us!

Sports
We are currently trying to procure prizes from professional athletes! If you want to donate something we can offer as a reward, please email: josh@fieldhouseproject.org. 


SOLD


Large Masks - 18 x 4.5 inches


Paintings


Four Trees (Below) - SOLD




More Information

Financials

  • The construction is estimated to cost between $35,000 - 45,000 USD.
  • Since January 2014, we have raised nearly $21,000 from our close connections.
  • Funds raised by this campaign go directly towards constructing and equipping The Fieldhouse to last for decades. 
  • We are also fundraising through major donors, events, and will seek corporate sponsorships and foundation grants upon approval as 501c3.
  • The community of Nyanyano is contributing the land and helping build the facilities. This is a major contribution on their part. 

Implementation Timeline

For more information on our origin and progress thus far, click here.

7-Year Strategy

  • 2013-2014: Implement model in Nyanyano, Ghana
  • 2014-2016: Measure results with reports 1, 6, 12, and 24 months after operations at The Fieldhouse begin. We plan to scale the most successful aspects of our work in other locations that are yet to be determined. 
  • 2016-2020: The community will be responsible for funding most repairs and may seek funding from FHP for specific items. FHP will raise money through grants and annual fundraising drives as needed.

Location

For more information on why we picked Ghana, click here.

Design

For more information on the design of the building, click here.

The Cheerful Hearts Foundation

Cheerful Hearts is a registered grassroots non-profit, non-governmental organization based in Ghana. Its mission is to provide assistance and support to the rural community development needs in Ghana. CHF works in a wide range of areas such as education, health, and human rights. Its primary focus is to help eliminate child labor and trafficking from all the fishing communities within the Awutu Senya Districts of Ghana.  The Fieldhouse Project has worked with CHF since September, 2013, however, members of our team have worked with CHF for the last three years as volunteers. 

Who will manage it?

We have placed great emphasis on making this truly a tool for the community, by the community. Cheerful Hearts program manager Freeman A will be in charge of the program and executive director Eric A O oversee other programs offered at The Fieldhouse. The schedule of use and other rules will be determined by a team of six local educators (one per school), one member from CHF, and one from The Fieldhouse Project. 

Visit fieldhouseproject.org for more information. You can reach us at info@fieldhouseproject.org

story:
Who Are We?

Enactus Saint Mary’s is a community of student, academic and business leaders enabling progress through entrepreneurial action. Enactus allows students to take the skills they have developed in the classroom apply them to challenges in the real world. Guided by academic advisers and business experts, post-secondary student leaders across Canada create and implement community empowerment projects that transform lives and build a better, more sustainable world. 

Our successes are driven by the competitive spirit created by the hundreds of Enactus chapters worldwide. The events and expositions help students develop the kind of talent and perspective that is essential to becoming leaders among society. We currently operate eleven projects ranging from working with at-risk youth, eliminating barriers to the workforce, to educating imprisoned women, and to consulting small businesses and helping them realize their full potential.



                 

Additional Insight Into Our Projects (Click Video Links Below)

Fundraising Promo

2014 National Exposition Final Round Presentation by Saint Mary's University

Enactus Saint Mary's "Help Hunger Disappear"

Enactus Saint Mary's ''Options Youth"

Enactus Saint Mary's "Team Possibles Art Show"

How Can You Get Involved?

We need your help to raise $5000 so that we can make it possible for 40 students to attend the 2015 Enactus Canada National Exposition in Toronto, Ontario. Each student will need a total of $829.88 (Hotel & Flight) to cover the entire event and we are hoping that with some extra support from you that we can subsidize this cost for the students who want to participate in this amazing event. Donations may be used as charitable tax credits.

What Is The Enactus National Exposition?

The Enactus Canada National Exposition brings together student, academic and industry leaders from across the country to celebrate the achievements of Canada’s future leaders and the impacts they've made in their across global communities. Over the course of the three day event, students showcase how their community outreach projects and business ventures are enabling progress through entrepreneurial action. Through rounds of live, presentation based competition, business execs. serving as judges determine which Enactus team and student entrepreneurs will be named National Champions and represent Canada on the global stage.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any form of contribution is accepted and even if you cannot personally help us to reach our goal please feel free spread the word around about our campaign with friends, family and anyone you know. You can subscribe to our email notifications by emailing one of the name listed below. This will update you on events and activities we are hosting around the Halifax Regional Municipality. 

If you have any questions or would like more information about who we are or what we represent please contact:

  • Drew Blair, Manager of Sponsorship (drewblair35@gmail.com)
  • Mai Miyano, Co-president (maimiyano@hotmail.com)
  • Kelsey Webb, Co-president (kelseyjwebb@gmail.com)

Also please visit our website by clicking the link below

Enactus Saint Mary's Official Website

THANK YOU

story:
Our undergrad team is currently hard at work on building Triteia.  An award-winning cube satellite in NASA’s Cube Quest competition, Triteia is set to be one of the first student projects and first spacecraft powered by a 3D printed thruster to orbit the moon.  Through our innovative 3D printing and design techniques, we’re making getting to space easier and cheaper than ever before!  

The Project:

Thruster: Callan is a 3D printed hydrogen peroxide thruster loaded with a silver catalyst bed to provide us with 4N of thrust.

Propellent Tank: Aluminum-lined composite pressure vessels that store our pressurized hydrogen peroxide fuel. The tanks also feature an internal bladder to avoid the mixing of helium and hydrogen peroxide.

IMU: The Inertial Measurement Unit (IMU) features space-rated accelerometers and gyroscopes to help us determine our attitude and thrust during maneuvers.

Camera: Optical imaging system allows us to collect data of surface lunar surface features and can be used for redundant navigation.

Solar Panel: Triple junction solar panels with 28% percent efficiency (3 times more efficient).

Reaction wheel: Used for fine control of the cube sat for pointing and detumbling. Uses the conservation of angular momentum to change the attitude (orientation) of the cube sat.

Transceiver: Radio transmitter/receiver (transceiver) with X-band downlink and S-band uplink/downlink. Capable of 30 Kbit/s with our antenna array.

Batteries: The battery consists of 8 Li-ion 18650 Cells with built in protections and redundancies to ensure the cube sat is always powered.

EPS (Electrical Power System): Our in-house electric power system distributes power to components and manages battery charging.

CHREC Space Processor: A radiation-tolerant processor based on the Zynq-7020 System on Chip. It runs Linux on board and is the main processor onboard the cube sat.  

Control Board: The reaction wheel control board controls the speed of the reaction wheel and powers its motor.

Separation Switch: A safety switch to avoid the cube sat from booting or starting up in the dispenser before deployment.

Interface Board: The interface board connects the different components together and carries the valve drivers for the propulsion system.

Callan, the 3D printed thruster providing maneuvering and propulsion capabilities

Who We Are:



Students for the Exploration and Development of Space (SEDS UCSD) is an entirely undergraduate organization that develops technology aimed at decreasing the cost of space exploration.  Through our research and production of 3D printed engines, as well as our development of projects such as a professional-grade rocket engine test stand sponsored by NASA and the first student rocket to be powered by a 3D printed liquid propellant engine, we’ve continued to push the boundaries of space innovation.  Now, we’re looking to the moon as strong competitors in NASA’s Cube Quest tournament.

Why Donate?

We'd like to thank our sponsors for their support:

Please note: Several external factors may affect Triteia's ability to launch.  The fulfillment of several perks (including the picture from the moon) and the launch of the project will depend on NASA's schedule for their Space Launch System and Cube Quest tournament results.  We are working to launch Triteia in 2018, however, SEDS UCSD is not responsible for delays/cancellations that result from changes in NASA's schedule or Cube Quest tournament results.
story_txt:
Our undergrad team is currently hard at work on building Triteia.  An award-winning cube satellite in NASA’s Cube Quest competition, Triteia is set to be one of the first student projects and first spacecraft powered by a 3D printed thruster to orbit the moon.  Through our innovative 3D printing and design techniques, we’re making getting to space easier and cheaper than ever before!  The Project:Thruster: Callan is a 3D printed hydrogen peroxide thruster loaded with a silver catalyst bed to provide us with 4N of thrust.Propellent Tank: Aluminum-lined composite pressure vessels that store our pressurized hydrogen peroxide fuel. The tanks also feature an internal bladder to avoid the mixing of helium and hydrogen peroxide.IMU: The Inertial Measurement Unit (IMU) features space-rated accelerometers and gyroscopes to help us determine our attitude and thrust during maneuvers.Camera: Optical imaging system allows us to collect data of surface lunar surface features and can be used for redundant navigation.Solar Panel: Triple junction solar panels with 28% percent efficiency (3 times more efficient).Reaction wheel: Used for fine control of the cube sat for pointing and detumbling. Uses the conservation of angular momentum to change the attitude (orientation) of the cube sat.Transceiver: Radio transmitter/receiver (transceiver) with X-band downlink and S-band uplink/downlink. Capable of 30 Kbit/s with our antenna array.Batteries: The battery consists of 8 Li-ion 18650 Cells with built in protections and redundancies to ensure the cube sat is always powered.EPS (Electrical Power System): Our in-house electric power system distributes power to components and manages battery charging.CHREC Space Processor: A radiation-tolerant processor based on the Zynq-7020 System on Chip. It runs Linux on board and is the main processor onboard the cube sat.  Control Board: The reaction wheel control board controls the speed of the reaction wheel and powers its motor.Separation Switch: A safety switch to avoid the cube sat from booting or starting up in the dispenser before deployment.Interface Board: The interface board connects the different components together and carries the valve drivers for the propulsion system.Callan, the 3D printed thruster providing maneuvering and propulsion capabilitiesWho We Are:

story:
We express sincere appreciation to the incredibly generous support of all contributors who have helped us hit our campaign goal in just 20 days! THANK YOU!!!

Very soon we will start first steps towards equipping the school with new technology and insulation before the next cold winter comes.

We now have only 10 days left to reach our stretch goal: for $8,000 we can bring LIGHT and WARMTH to the school! With your support we will bring Guzgef children BACK TO SCHOOL!

Due to increasing energy crisis, particularly in winter times, Tajikistan is considered as the most vulnerable country in Central Asia with the least capacity to adapt to future consequences of climate change. There are an estimated 24,000 households in rural Tajikistan living in OFF-GRID areas with NO access to an adequate energy supply. High level of poverty rate, lack of powered school facilities and absence of adequate schools infrastructure in remote areas force village schools to rely on wood and coal burning to meet their energy needs, which significantly harms people’s health and the environment.

Guzgef village school #87 is one of those OFF-GRID schools, where students are forced to study in DARK and COLD classrooms, MISS many days of school, and in conditions of light-scarcity DROP-OUT to get involved in labor.


WHY GUZGEF

Located in mountainous village Guzgef (350 residents, 65 households) at an altitude of 2000 meters above the sea level, secondary school #87 provides education to 137 disadvantaged rural children of 7 to 16 years of age, who would otherwise lack access to it. The school is also home for 35 school children from two neighboring villages, who travel 1km through the mountainous routes every day to attend the school.

Due to hard-to-reach geographical location, both the school and surrounding villages are not connected to an electricity grid and rely on coal burning which in turn causes children to suffer ill health caused by indoor smoke.


THIS IS OUR PLAN

Solar Team comprised of Guzgef school children and passionate individuals from NGO“Little Earth”, Public Fund"Rushdi Tojikiston" and “FLEX Alumni”community, with technical assistance of UNDP and the Association of Innovative and Technological Entrepreneurship, created an ambitious plan to help resolve the problem of energy crisis and provide opportunity to use renewable energy solutions, such as solar panels to improve children’s education in rural Guzgef.

For procurement and installation we need to reach at least $6500, while reaching stretch goal of $8000 will cover all additional installation cost.

By introducing Guzgef village school with green energy solutions, we hope to improve study conditions, strengthen local communities and provide better education opportunities for rural schoolchildren. Guzgef school will not only become a brighter place for learning, but also an example for future crowdfunding projects expected to improve education facilities in rural Tajikistan.

A pledge or donation of $400 could buy an entire solar panel and provide school children with access to education. However any donation, big or small, would be greatly appreciated.


FOR EVERY $1 YOU DONATE

UNDP will provide another $1 to help EQUIP the school building with proper INSULATION.


YOU CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE

By donating to this campaign, you are helping to:

- Increase the number of children (especially GIRLS) attending school

- Decrease the rates of respiratory diseases  (caused by burning coal)

- Improve education facilities in rural Tajikistan

-Increase the knowledge on benefits of green solutions


WHAT HAS BEEN DONE SO FAR

In close collaboration with Administration of Guzgef village school, technical experts from UNDP Croatia and UNDP Tajikistan conducted an ENERGY AUDIT of the school to reveal the most cost-effective measures for the installation of solar PV system and energy efficient lightening in the school. Additional proposed measures included roof insulation and repairs (new doors and windows, placement of wooden floors in the school).

Apart from the energy audit, Solar Team conducted several lectures for teachers and an art class for children to educate them on the importance of renewable energy sources and energy efficiency in environmental protection.

With support of partners, number of on-the-ground social events were organized to engage different community members and collect a portion of required funds through donations from local community.


WHAT IF WE GATHER MORE OR LESS THAN PLANNED

The installed capacity will depend on the total amount of funds donated. If more is gathered than planned, the remaining funds will be invested into establishment of education corner (computer lab with computers) to engage children in environmental learning and help them learn more about benefits of green energy sources.

If fewer funds are collected, the total amount of money gathered through this campaign will be DOUBLED by UNDP and the minimum cost-effective solar power plant will be installed on the roof of Guzgef village school to provide children with 24 HOUR ACCESS TO EDUCATION.

JOIN OUR SOLAR MOVEMENT

Invest in Guzgef Solar School  and help us INCREASE the number of children attending school in rural Guzgef.

Your donation will shape the future of a region, where small scale projects still have a measurable impact.

OUR REWARDS

*For your contributions, special rewards will be shipped world-wide once the campaign ends. We will send out an update after the campaign with the estimated deliveries for the rewards that need to be shipped. We will keep you posted.*

OUR TEAM

We appreciate any kind of help you can provide.

We are pleased to inform that our story was featured on:

UNDP: http://www.tj.undp.org/content/tajikistan/en/ho...

FLEX Alumni Newsletter: http://www.bradleyherald.org/2016/06/02/brighte...

UNDP Voices of Eurasia: http://europeandcis.undp.org/blog/2016/06/03/cr...

And Media: http://rus.ozodi.org/a/27739929.html

Share our project with friends who would be interested in it, and follow us here: https://www.facebook.com/Guzgef.Solar.School.crowdfunding/

This campaign is launched within the framework of the UNDP AltFinance Lab and Crowdfunding Academy and is supported by the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Slovakia 



OUR PARTNERS AND MEDIA SUPPORT

story:
Diolch / Thank you

I'r rheiny a gyfrannodd at ein hymgyrch codi arian y llynedd, hoffem ddiolch o waelod calon i chi am eich caredigrwydd. Mae eich haelioni wedi cyfrannu at flwyddyn lwyddiannus iawn yn hanes y mudiad, ac rydym yn awyddus i sicrhau bod ein gweithgarwch yn parhau i gynyddu.

Sincere thanks to all who supported our fundraising campaign last year. Your generosity played a large part in what has been a highly successful year for the movement, and we're determined to ensure that our activity continues to grow. 

Ein bwriad / Our aim

Ein bwriad yw archebu rhagor o'r nwyddau a gynhyrchwyd gennym y llynedd (hynny yw, crysau-T, pamffledi, sticeri a matiau cwrw). Rydym hefyd yn awyddus i gynhyrchu nwyddau newydd er mwyn hyrwyddo negeseuon mwy cyfredol. Byddwn yn dosbarthu'r nwyddau hyn yn y ffeiriau glas a gynhelir mewn Prifysgolion a Cholegau Addysg Bellach ledled Cymru yn yr hydref. Yn ogystal, hoffem greu pecynnau i gefnogi canghennau newydd o Plaid Ifanc sydd wedi'u sefydlu'n ddiweddar mewn amrywiol ardaloedd ledled Cymru. Bydd y pecynnau hyn yn yn cynnwys adnoddau a nwyddau i hyrwyddo neges y mudiad mewn ardaloedd lleol ac i roi'r canghennau newydd ar ben ffordd.

Our aim is to replenish our stock of merchandise created last year (namely T-shirts, pamphlets, stickers and beer mats). We would also like to design and create new merchandise in order to promote a more current message. We will be distributing these items during the Freshers' Fairs that will be held in Universities and FE Colleges across Wales in the autumn. We'd also like to create guidance packs to support the new branches of Plaid Ifanc that have been established in recent months across Wales. These packs will include resources and merchandise to promote our message as a movement in local areas and to give these new branches some initial guidance.

Yr hyn sydd ei angen arnom / What we need

Mae'r gost o gyfrannu at gynhadledd ffeministaidd lwyddiannus dros ben (ar y cyd â EFAy a Centre Maurits Coppieters) ym mis Mehefin wedi ein gadael braidd yn brin...! Rydym hefyd yn fudiad eithaf bach, sy'n dibynnu ar y cyfan ar garedigrwydd aelodau "llai ifanc" o Blaid Cymru i'n hariannu. Y gobaith yw codi rhyw £500 i ariannu ein costau cynhyrchu dros y misoedd nesaf. Bydd y nwyddau hyn ar gael i ni eu dosbarthu drwy gydol y flwyddyn sydd i ddod. Rydym, wrth reswm, yn gwerthfawrogi pob rhodd.

Plaid Ifanc recently contributed financially to the highly successful feminism conference in Cardiff (held in conjunction with EFAy and Centre Maurits Coppieters). This cost has left us a little low on funds....! We're a relatively small movement, and we depend on the "less young" members of Plaid Cymru for a large amount of our funding. We hope to raise £500 to fund our design and promotion costs over the next few months. We will be distributing these items for the rest of the year. Naturally, we appreciate every contribution. 

Eich effaith / Your impact

Mewn cyfnod cythryblus fel hwn, mae gwaith mudiad fel Plaid Ifanc yn fwy perthnasol nag erioed o'r blaen. Rydym yn ymdrechu i adeiladu mudiad ieuenctid sy'n ceisio gwneud y frwydr dros ryddid yn berthnasol ac yn ddeniadol i bobl ifanc Cymru heddiw. Mae Plaid Ifanc ei hun hefyd wedi cael blwyddyn lwyddiannus dros ben - daeth dros 50 o bobl ifanc i'n cynhadledd flynyddol eleni, ac rydym yn benderfynol ein bod yn mynd i gynnal y momentwm dros y misoedd nesaf. Byddai eich rhodd, beth bynnag fo'i faint, yn ein cynorthwyo i gryfhau elfen hanfodol o'r mudiad cenedlaethol. Diolch yn fawr am eich cefnogaeth!

In such difficult and turbulent times, we believe that Plaid Ifanc's message and contribution is more important than ever. We strive to build a youth movement that makes the fight for national liberation relevant and attractive to young people today. The past year has also been a highly successful one for Plaid Ifanc - more than 50 young people attended our annual conference this year, and we're determined to maintain this momentum over the coming months. Your donation, however large or small, would help us to strengthen a crucial element of the national movement. Thanks for your support!

Mae Plaid Ifanc ei hun hefyd wedi cael blwyddyn lwyddiannus dros ben - daeth dros 50 o bobl ifanc i'n cynhadledd flynyddol eleni, ac rydym yn benderfynol ein bod yn mynd i gynnal y momentwm dros y misoedd nesaf. We strive to build a youth movement that makes the fight for national liberation relevant and attractive to young people today. The past year has also been a highly successful one for Plaid Ifanc - more than 50 young people attended our annual conference this year, and we're determined to maintain this momentum over the coming months. Your donation, however large or small, would help us to strengthen a crucial element of the national movement. Thanks for your support!

story:
Team Classroom Champions - Go USA!

Looking for Canada? Go here

Teamwork is fundamental to everything we do, from the authentic relationships we nurture between kids and athlete mentors, to the critical skills learned so that kids can truly support each other to succeed both inside and outside the classroom.  

Friendship and trust define the relationship between our students and their Olympian, Paralympian or college athlete mentor. Mentors and kids develop friendships through hundreds of video lessons and multiple live video chats throughout the school year. Athlete mentors also visit schools and participate in wider community events.

The results are life changing as kids experience higher classroom engagement, increased confidence in their ability to set and achieve ambitious goals, increased digital literacy, and improved social skills. Study after study shows that the more engaged kids are in class, the more likely they are to persevere in school and pursue productive careers and fulfilling lives.

Everyone on our team wins! Students' attendance and grades improve. Teachers are stronger performers, more engaged with their students, and better equipped to take on leadership positions in their schools. Athlete mentors show increased leadership skills. And families and communities are also engaged through teams that extend well beyond the classroom door.

Join Team Classroom Champions and be the champion our kids need! With your help, we can create more lessons that engage hearts and minds and get kids caring about themselves and each other. With your help, we can keep kids working together to create champion classrooms and champion lives. Even the smallest contribution can make a huge impact!




Team up to make the dream work!
Help us share our story and tell the world about what we do and why we're making a difference! Create and share your own version of our sample post:"@ClassroomChampions (Facebook) @ClassroomChamps (Twitter) helps kids [insert your words here]!" Use #TeamCC. The link to this campaign is https://igg.me/at/CCCAN16. 




Did we mention the AWESOME perks available to donors through this campaign? Score some limited edition Team Classroom Champions swag with your contribution!





Prefer to mail in a check? Have questions? 
Please email Jill A. Pall, Director of Development at jpall@classroomchampions.org.

story:
2016 Outdoor Science Education Fundraiser

We need your help to give the Wren Avenue 4th and 5th graders the outdoor educational experience of a life time.

For several years now Wren Avenue Elementary School's Outdoor Education Program at Camp Silver Spur has brought amazing experiences and opportunities into the lives of our fourth and fifth graders.  But, we need your financial support to make it happen. 

Help create lifelong memories in the hearts of young children.

Our program offers three nights and four days of intensive learning about science, math, history, art, music and dance. Our teachers and staff believe that every child who wishes to attend camp should be allowed to participate in this opportunity of a lifetime. We rely heavily on fundraising and donations in order to make this happen. Although our fundraising efforts have been strong, we have a lot of work ahead of us.

One less cup of coffee may be all it takes.

We welcome all donations to this worthy cause of helping our students go to camp who may not otherwise be able to attend. A Cappuccino costs around 5 bucks for only one cup. If donating the cost of a Cappuccino is what you can give, we would be very grateful. That one donation would be a big help.

Could you give more? Ten, twenty or more dollars? We could use it.

If you are able to give more, fantastic! Every dollar helps. You can also help us by spreading the word on your Facebook page or on your Twitter feed.

What we need.

Our goal of $3,000.00 will help get our children to Camp Silver Spur. The cost of camp is $225.00 per student. This fee includes transportation, staff support, meals and lodging. We are actively raising funds but your support will be a huge help. $3,000 is an ambitious goal but even though we need approximately $10,000, every donation will bring us closer to making the Outdoor Education Camp happen. Your donation makes a difference!

The school does not pay for the trip.

Our population of students is diverse and represents many countries throughout the world. We are proud of our school community...it is wonderful. They love their children and support their education.

Coming up with $225.00 (the cost of camp per student) is not easy for many of our families. 

Approximately 70% of our students qualify for free or reduced lunch because they are economically disadvantaged. Most of our children come from hard-working families whose parents are facing financial challenges during these tough economic times. You’re your donations will make this year's important Outdoor Education at Camp Silver Spur happen.

Unsurprisingly, so many of our students have never had the opportunity to travel, take mini-vacations, visit a museum or even experience visiting a nearby urban city. Many of their travels are limited to visiting nearby friends or relatives. Please help us change this!

We need your financial support to make this happen.

Why should you help our students go to camp?

Educational experiences outside of the traditional classroom are just as valuable as the traditional classroom experiences. They help develop love of nature, and instill an appreciation for our environment. We want to nurture and foster our students' education by helping our community build productive, independent, well-rounded and positive citizens for a brighter future for all.
