story:
Who we are

Growing for Change is a charity that provides rural West African communities with the training and tools needed to preserve the world’s rainforests and overcome poverty.

The Issue

Agriculture and forest resources in Ghana, provide sustenance and revenue for over half the country’s population. Since 1950, the population has rocketed from 4 to 25million people. With an increased demand for forest products and land area for settlements, construction, energy and food, there has been a catastrophic rise in the level of deforestation - between 1990 and 2005 alone, Ghana lost over a quarter of its total national forest cover.

Deforestation is exacerbating rural poverty and threatening the livelihoods of forest dwelling people across the country. Without realistic mitigation policies, the country’s forests could completely disappear in less than 25 years…

What we need

Our Growing Ghana project aims to shift community focus from dependence on unsustainable practices and instead helps them adopt tree nurseries and forestry as income generating activities. Just £10,950 will cover the costs of training and employing a team of 10 locals to sustainably manage rainforests in the Twifo Praso region of Ghana. As well as reforesting areas of land lost to illegal logging, part of their role will also be to educate local communities about the importance of the rainforests for their overall livelihoods. 

Despite being paid 2 and a half times the daily Minimum Wage in Ghana, the average general labourers rate in this region is just 15 Cedis a day (equivalent to £2.40). On this salary people struggle to provide their families with the bare necessities such as clothing and food. We therefore want to push this salary up by 33% and pay our foresters a living wage of 20 Cedis (meaning that £10,950 will guarantee 10 workers training and a salary for a whole 10-months).

Gifts

It costs just £50 to cover the training of a forester and £100 to cover their salary for a month. Every £50 donation will receive a personalised ‘Growing For Change’ Jute Bag.

The Impact

Once established the team of foresters will use a newly built nursery to grow thousands of seedlings - many of which will be grown from cuttings of native tree species.

When these seedlings have matured, they will be planted into areas of wasteland previously devastated by timber exploitation, agriculture expansion, mining and unsustainable farming practices.

These new areas of rainforest will then be nurtured and managed over the coming years by the team of fully-trained foresters who in turn will educate people in the community about the importance of the forests to their overall livelihoods.

Not only will the sustainable management of the rainforests provide a better quality of life for the Ghanaians living there, efforts to restore global rainforest coverage throughout the world have many social and ecological benefits for us all.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thanks for taking a look at our campaign. Whether you contribute or not, please share the video with your friends - sharing the campaign is a huge help.

Please also follow us on Facebook and Twitter to keep up to date with our work.

Thank you.

story:
Give a Child the Chance to Be Fed, to Grow and to Flourish


Many of the children attending Ramon Rosa Elementary School in Honduras are living in poverty and struggle during school because they cannot afford to eat breakfast or lunch. As a result, we are raising funds to begin construction of a school kitchen, which will begin in May.

Construction will include all the equipment needed for the kitchen, installation of electricity, a cistern to have water for cooking as well as an area for the students to eat their meals.


We Need Your Help!

Building a functional school kitchen requires lots of support. With your help, we can end hunger for the children at Ramon Rosa Elementary and supply them with the option of a better future.

To complete the project and implement the meal plan, a total of $7,500 needs to be raised, but the initial $1,500 that we are collecting will enable us to begin construction in May! After the kitchen is built we only need 0.25 per child/day to provide them with  breakfast and lunch while they are at school. 

The school children can't wait to send you a personalized gift and photos as expressions of their gratitude for the difference you will make in their lives and their community.


About Our Nonprofit

I'm Nancy, the Founder of Mayor Potencial (Greater Potential). I grew up in Honduras, where 60% of the population is living in poverty. Since I left, not much has changed in places like my home town. Our mission at Mayor Potencial is to elevate educational standards and facilities in order to provide better opportunities for future generations in rural schools in Latin America. Our focus is initially on the youth in Honduras with the potential to expand to other developing countries in Latin America.


More About Our Gifts for Donors

Our HIGHEST 2 DONORS will receive a beautiful handmade box from skilled crafters in Honduras.
A huge thanks to all of our contributors who will help to make an amazing difference for the children at Ramon Rosa Elementary in Honduras.

story:
Who We Are and What We Do

The Bahath Centre, located in Moshi, Kilimanjaro, is home to 19 Tanzanian street children who have been orphaned by either neglect, abuse, or poverty.  Orphaned children and children whose families cannot properly provide for them come to the Centre for daily support, shelter, food, education, healthcare, guidance, and love.

The Bahath Centre was founded in June 2011 by two local Tanzanian men, Joseph Lyimo and Emmanuel Tesha.  Both Joseph and Emmanuel experienced difficult hardships as young children growing up in impoverished Tanzanian families, so they decided they wanted to help other children in their community who deal with similar struggles.

We don't see the Bahath Centre as an orphanage.  Instead, we see our Centre as one big family.  Our motto: The Home of Love and a Better Future for the Children.

Innocent (nicknamed Inno), a 10 year old boy, became part of our family a year ago when his guardian refused to provide him important necessities including education, supervision, and love.  As a baby, Inno suffered from an extremely dangerous bout of Malaria, leaving him with neurological seizures and Cerebral Palsy in the right side of his body.  As a result of both his illnesses and the prejudices that many Tanzanians have about people with disabilities, Inno had never attended any kind of education center.  Without an education, Inno is destined to remain dependent on others for survival.  Every day, Inno would watch as his friends and other children in his community left for school in the morning and came home from school in the afternoon.  Inno longed to learn.  He longed to go to school!   

As part of our family, we worked hard to find a school that could provide Inno with the right support he needed in order to learn.  Gabriella Rehabilitation Center, located half an hour away from the orphanage, is a private boarding school which caters to children with mental and physical disabilities.  They use Western based teaching techniques and styles with educated teachers from around the world volunteering their time for these children.  At Gabriella, Inno and his school mates learn more than academia - they learn how to survive.  Gabriella Rehabilitation Center works with each student to strengthen his or her physical and mental abilities, helping to ensure that each child has a future and is able to play a functioning role in Tanzanian society.      

Inno has been attending Gabriella since last October and has been happily and healthily striving!!!  


What We Need 

Private schools in Tanzania are extremely expensive and usually out of reach for the average Tanzanian family who typically lives off of less than $2 a day.

                             1 year at Gabriella, including boarding, costs $900.

This holiday season, we are looking to raise $2500 in 25 days in order to guarantee Innocent another 2 years of schooling at Gabriella as well as guarantee coverage of his medical and hospital bills.

             Please help us give Innocent the gift of a proper education and future!


Other Ways You Can Help

Help spread the word!  Share this campaign and information about our project with as many people as you can!  The more people who become aware of our Centre and our children, the more chances we have to make a difference!


For more information about our project:

Facebook:  www.facebook.com/bahathcentrefororphansus

Email:  bahathcentreus@gmail.com

Gabriella Rehabilitation Centre:  www.gabriellarehab.org


We are a registered NGO in Tanzania and will soon have 501c3 status in the United States.  Our Tanzanian NGO Registration Number is: NGO/00006312


                                        Pamoja, tunaweza kuleta tofauti!!!

                                    (Together, we can make a difference!!!)

story: The Mid-South Christian College student body is trying to raise money to go the International Conference on Missions in Columbus, Ohio. We have been able to attend every year thanks to some generous donations and are wanting to attend once more this year! We are currently asking for $2,500 - the amount we need to afford transportation to ICOM! However, the funding doesn't stop there. Any additional funds raised passed the $2,500 will continue to cover any other ICOM costs! Any more after that will go to our MSCC Student Council fund to help us continue to have fun events on and around campus!

story:
Hello Dream Funder!

My name is Sarah Marie McCabe and even in the first grade, I knew I wanted to be a teacher. Maybe it was the butterflies busting out of their cocoons in the classroom corner, or maybe it was Ms. Vensuela’s warm and upbeat enthusiasm for learning. Whatever it was, I was inspired enough to stick with this early and intuitive decision. Upon graduating from San Francisco State University in May 2013 with a Bachelor’s degree in Liberal Studies and American Literature, I planned on taking my passions of teaching English, digital/analog photography, and yoga abroad. And this is this chance!

My campaign will directly help fund the costs of travel from California to Thailand, Greenheart program fees, 4 weeks of TESOL certification courses, work visa fees, hostel fare for night of Bangkok arrival, and solidify a small emergency fund. As a contributor to this campaign you will fuel the fire for a yearlong experience as an English educator to elementary aged children in the southern community of Hua Hin, Thailand. This coastal community has a high volume of tourists and as English is becoming a prominent worldwide language, the demand for English teachers is increasing. With six years of in class and after school educational experience, I know that this international teaching opportunity is the next big step for me for to full-heartedly take.

Even if my entire goal is not achieved, know that your donated funds will still directly contribute to some of the costs mentioned earlier. I’m just open arms to whatever my friends, family, or awesome online supporters are willing to contribute. Whether it is $1 or $100, your contribution is truly funding a dream!

If you know of any other educators, travel enthusiasts, yogis, photographers, bookworms, or generally giving people who might be inspired to help out, spread the word via Facebook, email, or simply use the Indiegogo share tools.

Thanks for reading and I hope you are able to support my campaign. Either way, don’t forget you rock!

story:
My name is Joanna. Me and my husband Bogart have only one child Max. Max is 13 and since the age of 2 battles number of health problems. He is one of the bravest people we know. He goes through all the tests and therapies without any complains and he went through so much already.

When Max was a little boy he was diagnosed with autism after he had 17 ear infections and was treated with antibiotics for each one. Couple years ago Max has developed problems in his digestive system, extreme pains that had us rushing to emergency room and very bloated belly. We've had work with gastrologist for over a year trying to find the reason and cure for Max's problems, with no success. Until recently we went to an Iridologist who was able to finally help Max. With a new diet, herbal supplements and the beemer mat, Max made great progress already. He use to wake up screaming at night in pain and biting his wrists until bleeding. Now he sleeps through the whole night without these episodes. He no longer rocks back and forth biting himself. He is calm and relaxed and when I call his name he makes eye contact. When he know he is going to his therapy on the beemer mat he packs his backpack by himself. He never did that before we were so proud of him when he surprised us with this new gesture it was like watching a child walk for the first time. His chest was extremely swollen like a giant balloon filled his chest. The swelling went down 50% since the bemer therapy. Max started to talk now and his teacher at school told us he is making great progress.

WHAT MAX NEEDS AND WHAT YOU GET IN RETURN.

In return for your kindness/donation you will get therapy session(s) on Bemer mat. That is electromagnetic mat that improves microcirculation and promotes healing from chronic pain and inflammation in the body as well as increases overall energy and wellbeing. With this project for Max we also have the opportunity to help kids in our New Jersey area who struggle with similar illnesses. We want to share our success story so far and hope you can take advantage of the beemer mat and see how it could help you.

Max still has a long way to go. We are hoping to raise $ 7000 to buy Bemer mat for Max. Please see the link below to watch the movie about the mat: 30 minutes webinar : https://m.youtube.com/?reload=2&rdm=1ctoxzvl#/w...

THE IMPACT

Almost everyday after work my husband drives from New Jersey to New York, so Max can have a session on the Bemer mat. It takes him over three hours to do that. It takes a lot of commitment and energy to keep going. Anyone who has a child knows what parent goes thru when child is suffering. Having a Bemer mat at home would allow Max to have a session on it every day and continue to improve his health. Most of all we hope it will also bring awareness to our neighbours about this treatment and give them the opportunity to try the mat themselves. By donating, you will receive a number of visits on the bemer mat.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:)

If you can't help monetarily, I ask that you spread the word to those you think who can. Friends, family, anyone who could benefit from session on Bemer mat.

thank you, much love!!! Max, Joanna and Bogart.

That is electromagnetic mat that improves microcirculation and promotes healing from chronic pain and inflammation in the body as well as increases overall energy and wellbeing. With this project for Max we also have the opportunity to help kids in our New Jersey area who struggle with similar illnesses. We want to share our success story so far and hope you can take advantage of the beemer mat and see how it could help you.Max still has a long way to go. We are hoping to raise $ 7000 to buy Bemer mat for Max. Please see the link below to watch the movie about the mat:  30 minutes webinar :   https://m.youtube.com/?reload=2&rdm=1ctoxzvl#/w...THE IMPACTAlmost everyday after work my husband drives from New Jersey to New York, so Max can have a session on the Bemer mat. It takes him over three hours to do that. It takes a lot of commitment and energy to keep going. Anyone who has a child knows what parent goes thru when child is suffering. Having a Bemer mat at home would allow Max to have a session on it every day and continue to improve his health. Most of all we hope it will also bring awareness to our neighbours about this treatment and give them the opportunity to try the mat themselves. By donating, you will receive a number of visits on the bemer mat.OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:)If you can't help monetarily, I ask that you spread the word to those you think who can. Friends, family, anyone who could benefit from session on Bemer mat. thank you, much love!!! Max, Joanna and Bogart.

story:
What is Project Haiti?

Project Haiti is a student run organization at Temple University whose members fund-raise all year round for the needs of the 18 children at the St. Francis Xavier Orphanage in Petite Riviere De Artibonite, Haiti.

Project Haiti visits the orphanage each year over Spring Break in order to create lasting relationships with the children, Director Cenat Esperandieu and staff while connecting Temple University to the Haitian community.

 Last year we were able fund the completion of a new kitchen with a concrete floor, creating a more sanitary cooking environment for the orphanage while reducing the risk of food borne illness.

We embrace diversity, Haitian culture and the mutual benefits of serving others through building global friendships! 

What We Need From You

$5,000 USD in order to execute and sustain The Chicken Project. 

    The Impact

     Each year, Project Haiti has the opportunity to see the results of our fundraising efforts directly when we visit the orphanage over Spring Break.

    This year Project Haiti will initiate The Chicken Project, entailing the construction of chicken coups on the orphanage property as well as purchasing the chickens necessary to fill them.  The goal of The Chicken Project is to establish a skill building initiative for the children to begin learning some basic agricultural and entrepreneurial skills that will provide sustainable and long lasting benefits.

    The Chicken Project is an important step in increasing the overall quality of life for the children at St. Francis Xavier. Project Haiti recognizes the potential of every child and we wish to not only provide access to better health and education in the classroom, but to also provide them with hands-on learning experiences. We hope that this experience will not only teach them the skills to take care of chickens but to also work together to empower each other, just as we hope children all over the world are given the opportunity to do. 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      We appreciate your interest even if you cannot contribute. If you want to help support our cause in other ways, share our story! Don't forget to follow us on Instagram @tuproject.haiti and like us on Facebook at Facebook.com/TUProjectHaiti

story:
I Want to Help

I feel so fortunate for everything in my life. I've been able to achieve so much in my brief 22 years, but there are many people my age and younger that haven't gotten the same opportunities I have. This holiday season, I want to do my part in helping those that assist the homeless youth population in Utah. Many believe that hunger and poverty aren't serious issues in our state, but they are and the Volunteers of America, Utah do a number of services to feed, support and educate homeless youth in our area. 

This holiday season, I'm hoping to raise even a small amount of money to support VOAUT and their homeless youth programs, with a goal to make a difference in even one struggling youth's life.

Only $5 Makes a Difference

If all of my Facebook friends donated $5 today, we could raise over $3,000 to help homeless youth in Utah. What does $5 mean to you? A drink at the bar? A cup of coffee? A treat at the movies? 

For VOAUT, $5 can mean a meal for a hungry child, a warm blanket, a bar of soap. 

I campaign this holiday season to make our money count for more by spending it in the right place. A place that can make a difference. 

Share the Love

If you're able to donate today, I want to say thank you. I also want to encourage you, whether you donate or not, to share this Indiegogo page with your friends and family and motivate them to give to VOAUT and the Homeless Youth Resource Center via this campaign. It's one of the best, simplest gifts you can give this holiday season.


I will personally give the funds raised here to VOAUT at the start of 2015, when this campaign ends. Perhaps we can help struggling youth in Salt Lake City start the year off right and make 2015 a year for change and betterment. 

Learn more @ http://www.voaut.org/

story:
My name is Rose Winstanley-Trefz, In 2012, with a desire to help raise awareness of what women are dealing with globally, and to try to empower, inspire and inform people, I started a Facebook page and group called Worldwide Women's Support Circle. As of July 2014, WWSC  has connected to over 3200 women globally. 

One of the amazing women who I met is Zephaniah. Zephaniah is an educator and women's rights advocate from Gujranwala District in Pakistan. Zephaniah operates Zephaniah Free Education a school for girls and young women who cannot afford an education.  In Pakistan, as Zephaniah says, "There is a danger and one thing that can ruin our world and that is illiteracy. Girls and women are not empowered and there is only one solution to all our problems, and that is education and awareness of women’s rights. I want every girl to be educated, empowered and protected.” 

As of 2014, Zephaniah has helped teach and empower 500 girls. She has a  ‘Women's Learning Center’ where students are taught sewing, stitching and embroidery, and a beauty salon area where young women learn hair dressing, make-up artistry and other skills. Zephaniah has an education program with up to 100 students, as well as an English language course. Zephaniah does all this for free for the poor of her local community. 

In July, 2014 Worldwide Women's Support Circle put out an appeal for funds to raise money to get a Computer Center up and running for Zephaniah Free Education. With one generous donor, we were able to complete Phase One of the Computer Center.  Zephaniah had enough money to have electricity installed, and lights and a ceiling fan put up, tables were made that have space for the three computers as well as room for the three laptops we want to provide as part of phase II for the Computer. (Photo below)  

                                


With the three computers Zephaniah Free Education was recently gifted, she will teach 9 students at a time. The computer program training will take three months to complete. In one year there will be 108 girls who will benefit from the computer program. With the three additional laptop computers the numbers of students will double to 216 in a year!

WHAT WE NEED TO COMPLETE COMPUTER CENTER


3 laptop computers, $300 each                              Total $900

Strong door for Computer Center                                      $150

Uninterruptible power supply (UPS) Battery back-up   $200 

Solar Energy Charger                                                             $200

Printer                                                                                        $200

Misc. supplies                                                                          $50

Total  To Complete Computer Center                           $1700    

HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL HELP TRANSFORM GIRLS LIVES:

  • The computer center will enhance learning and achievement in a variety of subjects with an emphasis on developing knowledge and skills using the latest technology 
  • Provide access to opportunities for girls and young women to allow them to focus on their own interests and human potential through access to technology.
  • This computer center will allow global connections to other children and learning opportunities that they would not have access to otherwise.                     


According to the organization, One Laptop Per Child, ”As the pace of change in the world increases dramatically, the urgency to prepare all children to be full citizens of the emerging world also increases dramatically. . . The best preparation for children is to develop the passion for learning and the ability to learn how to learn.The root cause of the rapid change, digital technology, provides a solution. When every child has a connected laptop, they have in their hands the key to full development and participation. Limits are erased as they can learn to work with others around the world, to access high-quality, modern materials, to engage their passions and develop their expertise."

THANK YOU FOR YOUR DONATION! KNOW HOW POWERFUL YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL BE TOWARDS HAVING A POSITIVE IMPACT TO EMPOWER GIRLS AND WOMEN! 

If you are having difficulty with Indiegogo donation page, please try donations here: Worldwide Womens Support Circle Donations

story:
Education Village envisions a Tanzania where all children have equal access to quality education and opportunities to be successful and meaningful contributors to their society.


5 great reasons to support us!

1. A donation, no matter how small will allow us to fill a childs belly

2. The school gardening project will create a fun and productive activity for the children

3. You can help reduce the incidence of malnutition amongst our students

4. Better nutrition = better brain function

5. This project will be a stepping stone to more! This will include improving infrastructure, teacher training and eventually allowing doctors to attend the remote village for regular check ups.

Who are we?

Education Village was founded by Linda, a Doctor working in northern Tanzania. As an alamna of Tingatinga Primary School she has first hand knowledge of the struggles pupils go through just to get an education. ."


Who do we want to help?

For many children, particularly in rural communities inadequate nutrition deprives them of the mental and physical energy they need to achieve their potential.

Tingatinga Primary School educates around 400 pupils per year in Northern Tanzania.We aim to directly impact these 400 students  and indirectly assist more than 100 families from three villages meet the nutritional needs of their children.

Food insecurity has been a constant burden upon villagers. Inadequate nutrition, therefore, presents a major challenge to school attendance resulting in poor performance and education outcomes amongst primary school students.


"My education has value no matter where I come from."


Why now?

For a period of ten years an international food aid program provided food aid to the students in this school, this had a major impact on the education of children in drought areas of northern Tanzania. 

In 2014 the program halted supplies of food to these areas, school attendance and performance have dramatically declined and continue doing so, with large numbers of children simply dropping out of school. A major factor in the rising drop-out rate is that many children in these areas are “just too hungry” to properly focus on their education.

How do we plan to help?

Students stand in front of the school field. They are excited to begin gardening


School Gardening Project

Our immediate goal is to provide a sustainable food source to the children of Tingatinga Primary School. Long term, we aim to duplicate the School Gardening Project in surrounding villages,  extending our program’s reach to  rural villages across Tanzania.

The School Gardening Project comprises three main objectives for the successful cultivation of food, through establishing a gardening project on the grounds surrounding the school:

Fencing

Tingatinga Village is situated near the northern Wildlife migration corridor making it prone to frequent wildlife crop raiding. So the school fencing is needed to protect the garden from wildlife destruction.

Irrigation

Currently, the water tank that is required to supply water to the school is not functioning; we plan on renovating the system currently implemented in order to allow a continuous supply of water to the school and garden. 

Cultivation

The Tingatinga Primary School garden will raise food crops that can be sold, with the profits used to help provide nutritious, balanced meals for all the children in the school. 

How will we determine project success?

As the project aims at improving the nutritional status, school attendance and successful education outcomes of children in the proposed area two measures that will be used to determine project success:

  1. School attendance records and students performance 
    - Assessing the changes in school attendance, 
    - truancy level and 
    - school performance after initiation of the feeding project will serve as a success indicator.
  2. Nutritional status assessment
    - Recording and comparing children’s weight, length for height and mid upper arm  circumference before the initiation of feeding project and six months after running a  successful feeding project.       Nai, 11, gives us a tiny smile. She has just returned back to class after recess. 

An empty classroom at Tingatinga Primary School. 

What will we do with your donation?



Education Village's primary goal is to improve school conditions in villages across Tanzania. The School Gardening Project is the first hurdle in a long race to better the school enviroment in these regions. 

With continued support and donations we aim to;

1. Establish the school feeding project in other villages around Tanzania.

2. Provide school materials i.e. notebooks, reading materials, backpacks and uniforms.

3. Create a teacher development programs at these schools to improve content of education.

4. Begin providing medical check ups for the students, to alleviate any illness that may be hindering
   their education.

5. Improve infrastructure i.e. classrooms, the kitchen and teacher housing on school grounds. 

what do they want to be when they grow up?

Thank you for visiting our page!

Visit our website and facebook page for more information. Get involved! Like, share and support!

story:
Summary

We are raising money to make big events in Piedmont Park better for surrounding neighborhoods. 

Piedmont Park is a prized destination for many of the City's largest events – but the accompanying traffic snarls, closed streets, limited access, and disruption to work, school, and neighborhood life are real problems. 

The City has processes it uses to work with event organizers and impacted neighborhoods. The organizers of this campaign believe these processes can and must be improved.

To effect change at City Hall we need credible information and recommendations. 

We are raising money for independent research and recommendations by nationally recognized Nelson-Nygaard. The study costs $24,000.

What We Need & What You Get

If you believe as we do that existing city processes for big events in the park can be improved, select a donation level and please support the study. 

100% of your contribution will fund the Nelson-Nygaard study. The study is also backed by a coalition including the Virginia-Highland Civic Association (VHCA), the Ansley Park Civic Association, the Midtown Neighborhood Association and the Morningside/Lenox Park Association (MLPA), as well as City Council members Alex Wan, Mary Norwood, Kwanza Hall, and Andre Dickens.

Nelson-Nygaard will use this year’s Music Midtown to:

  • Examine traffic and parking
  • Study local community impacts
  • Evaluate the City’s processes and agencies
  • Look at best practices from other cities
  • Recommend policies and procedures for Atlanta

We support holding great events in Piedmont Park, but we want a process that both protects the park and ensures that safety and quality of life are respected for surrounding neighborhoods. This will take a change in City policy and procedure. 

This formal study will identify tools and best practices to improve City policy and procedure. We and others will use the study to work with the City. We’re seeking donations to help defray the cost of this study. 

The Impact

We expect to lessen the impact of big events on traffic, parking, and safety for neighborhoods surrounding Piedmont Park.

    Risks & Challenges

    Of course, a study and change at City Hall are two different things. But. this project is backed by City Council members Alex Wan, Mary Norwood, Kwanza Hall, and Andre Dickens. This project is also backed by the Ansley Park Civic Association, the Midtown Neighborhood Association and the Morningside/Lenox Park Association as well as the Virginia-Highland Civic Association. It will take effort and political will from all of us, but we are optimistic that the City will use this study to improve its policies and procedures.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Whether or not you contribute, we hope you will use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about this campaign.

story:
Summary

Well folks, it is time for me to head back to Switzerland for my 2nd summer school intensive at EGS, the European Graduate School.  After this summer, I will write my thesis, head back to Saas-Fee once more to defend it, then I will have my Master's in Expressive Arts Therapy.  

Having my Master's Degree, especially in a field that makes my soul feel passionately alive, will be an accomplishment I can be proud of.  Not only that, it will help me to secure a better job doing what I love: facilitating a healing process through the power of creative expression.  

And you can help: EGS has a Matching Scholarship fund, wherein they will match up to 50% (usually about 25%, given demand and funds available) of money I independently raise towards my tuition fees.  It would be an honour to have you support me in making my dream come true.  


What I Need & What You Get

Here's the cost breakdown:

Tuition:  CHF 6270 (Swiss Francs).  With the exchange rate at the time of writing, this works out to $7849.29 CAD.  Half of this has been paid already as a deposit, so I need to pay approximately $3925 more.  

Room and Board:  CHF 1958, or $2451.18 CAD.  This includes accommodation with room mates and 3 meals per day. 

Airfare and train fare:  Approximately $2000 CAD.  

Overall, this works out to about $12,300 CAD.  The matching scholarship applies to tuition only; HOWEVER, any funds I raise above and beyond will help me to recoup the additional costs involved.

Remember, every dollar you donate will amount to MORE because a percentage will be matched.  If you give $100, it's like you are giving me $125.  This is an exciting way to maximize your donation!  

You'll see to the right a list of perks you will receive for donating.  Everything will be personally crafted by me, to express my gratitude for your participation.  


The Impact

At this time, I don't qualify for student loans.  I have some savings, but the rest will be going on a line of credit.  Luckily, I have 6 years to complete the program.  I have been working hard for the past 2 years to pay off year one and to save for year two.  My goal is to stay financially stable throughout this program, and the flexible timeline and financial aid like this Matching Scholarship will help me get there.  

Expressive Arts Therapy is a powerful way to heal and grow.  It helps us tap into the right hemisphere of the brain and find creative solutions to what feels emotionally stuck. It has been immensely beneficial to me personally, and it is something I would like to give back to the world in the time I have on this planet.  By participating, you can help me do my bit to make the world a better place! 

To learn more about Expressive Arts Therapy and the work I already do, see my website.  You can also learn about the certificate program I took here in Vancouver from 2009-2011 by clicking here. And to find out more about EGS and the Matching Scholarship Fund, click here.  


Other Ways You Can Help

If you're excited about participating, please consider taking a moment to email this to key people in your contacts who you think will be excited too.  Tell them how you know me, and that you support my cause!  

Thank you again for your support.

story:
It's All About Dreams...

 Keiki means "kids" in Hawaiian. Keiki Radio is the Hawaii division of Kidstar Radio Network. Kidstar has been helping children find their passion & do a radio show about it, for 27 years. As the video above shows, "there is no box", as founder Perry Damone says.

My name is Randy Zachary, a 35 year radio veteran who can think of no better way to "finish well" than to help children find their voice and connect globally. Growing up in an alcoholic home, I wasn't allowed a voice, so for me, this is personal. More about me at www.randyzachary.com.

In terms of connecting children globally, maybe if we shrunk the world for them, we'd need less guns. Just sayin'...

Our mission is to help kids find their passion via radio, and then collaborate to end keiki hunger & homelessness in Hawaii, and beyond.


You Can Be A Keiki Radio Hero.

We need $15,000 for equipment, a vehicle, and start up promotion. We've had office space donated by the Maui Dive Shop - mahalo!

Whether you live on the mainland or in Hawaii, we have some very cool perks for you as a way of saying MAHALO for caring for keiki. It's very important that we reach our goal.

 We're looking for 15 Heroes to donate $100, and find 9 other Heroes to do the same...15 x $1,000 = $15,000. THis is very doable! Would you be a Keiki Radio Hero Recruiter? If you do, we'll say "thank you" with...

1. A Keiki Radio Hero Thank You Certificate, suitable for framing.

2. Your business or family logo / link on our "Wall of Fame"

3. ONE LIVE remote broadcast per quarter at your business or family event!


In A World Where Kids Are Losing Hope...

Keiki Radio inspires children to discover & pursue their dreams. Additionally, the power of radio is then leveraged to help them make a difference in their community.


Can't Help Financially?

Help us spread the word via social media! Ask your school to help, or maybe reach out to keiki here, become a "Skype" or Pen Pal. Start a Kidstar radio station at your school...!

story:
Summary

Over recent months we have been developing exciting plans to build a Marine Discovery Centre and Coffee House at Greyhope Bay in Torry, Aberdeen - The Greyhope Bay Project. To help publicise and create awareness about our project we are looking to sponsor a dolphin sculpture as part of the Wild Dolphin Exhibition coming to Aberdeen this summer.

The Greyhope Bay Project seeks to raise the profile of Aberdeen as a city of culture and to engage the local community and visitors with the marine wildlife we have on our doorstep, in particular the dolphins which are regularly seen at the entrance to the harbour. The proposed marine centre will be a new and unique facility for the city with views of Aberdeen harbour, city and coastline; it will hope to become a “destination” of choice for numerous visitors and drive forward regeneration of the local area.

Although the Greyhope Bay Project has been gathering momentum fast, it is important for us to gain as much support as possible from the community to help make this project a reality.

To have a Greyhope Bay Project dolphin sculpture would be an amazing opportunity to promote our community based initiative and will create awareness, attracting focus to the area where we hope to develop our Marine Centre. The Whale and Dolphin Conservation and ARCHIE foundation are leading on this city-wide public art event that will see 50 giant dolphin sculptures, individually designed and painted by local artists, dotted around the city. Wild Dolphins is a participative and highly visible event, which is set to be the talking point of the summer and Aberdeen's largest 2014 visitor attraction.

With your contribution you will not only be able to personally feel ownership of the Greyhope Bay Dolphin during the exhibition but you will also be supporting WDC, the ARCHIE foundation and our aims to:

  • provide an educational resource focused on the marine environment 
  • attract and encourage people to explore the local area and discover the impressive scenery and wildlife on offer
  • facilitate tourism development and support the development of the local community

What We Need & What You Get

The Greyhope Bay Project needs to raise £2000 to help us sponsor a dolphin to be included as part of the Wild Dolphins Exhibition which is running from 23rd June – 29th August. More info on the exhibition can be found at WildDolphins. Click here to read about the success of a similar exhibition in Bristol, where Gromit (Wallace & Gromit) sculptures were placed around the city.

All money raised will go towards funding a dolphin sculpture. If we do not raise our target amount we will seek the remaining funds from a local business to help with sponsorship of the dolphin sculpture.

You can find out more information about the Greyhope Bay Project here and you can also follow us on twitter @greyhopebay.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute that is not a problem! Please share our fundraising campaign and make some noise about our project. Share the link through Facebook, Twitter and email and very soon you could be visiting the Greyhope Bay Dolphin sculpture in Aberdeen!

Thanks for taking the time to read this far! With your help we can make a real change in Aberdeen and bring confidence to the community about the amazing city in which we live.

story:
The Reality of Things:

My name is Lucrecia Ramona de Jesus and I'm 16 years old. I was originally born in Pacific Coast of Colombia, however when I was 12 due to political reasons my family and I had to come to Australia. Starting all over again in this new country as refugees, no money or english in hand, my parents and I have had to once again build everything we ever had from scratch, we had no language, we had no home and we had no friends.

Living in Australia although it has really helped me with my art and my plans for the future, plans that follow those steps of the master painters. Growing up in a humble family where all the skills I learned, no matter if they were sporting, academical or artistically were supported, and now that I want to embark this new challenge to share my culture and opportunity with new people, my parents aid won't be enough, I push myself to strive my dreams nevertheless there are dreams that need help from more than friends and family.

lurking around the museums

 

photo 1 (Determined to learn another language, I went to a German class where I was surprised to find I was the only minor.) 

photo 2 (One of my concerts, where I performed, various cultural dances as well as classical.)

One of my big passions cultivated since the first time I could ever hold a pencil, since the first time I would paint in the dinning table my parents and I will soon discover of a talent somehow natural and raw, which I have polished to become what I am now. My goal in a near future is to work in the fields of  art, visually and expressive, I'm growing to sculpt a career where I can utilise my dance skills as well as my passion of drawing and painting. 


How did I come to know about UWC?

Ever since my elder sister got accepted into UWC India, I remember curiously gazing across my parents bed as they would melancholy talk to her. I was only 8 at the time but I vividly remember the anecdotes of mystery and adventure of this new life she was living, now days her hunger for learning is still getting feed by her constant studies, it was clear for me that I wanted to follow my own path. The day came and I too applied to UWC following that hereditary trace and once again in the family I was accepted, I had now entered what I like to call the ring of the bull. 

By only getting 60% of a scholarship we were all so exited yet worried with struggles to come, a major set back for us was the money to pay the school. 

by Lucrecia Ramona de Jesus, work in progress 


What now? 

To make this 'dream' come true, I only need a push to actually be able to reach the bull, as a small girl with a small family who has just started in a new country, our income isn't big, therefore to be able to make this happen I need you! you out there reading this, in a magical world 20,000 dollars would cover all the scholarship expenses, however talking in a reality level every single collaboration will make a difference! 


Why is the question?

Why should you contribute? 

Imagine a world inspired by peace and sustainability, such world only capable of uniting people, nations and cultures for such a future that UWC promotes its students to become challenged and ready to take action.

Imagine that future near ours, well that is possible! by educating young people. This is why I think its crucial to invest in education, starting with singular people who will create a positive change in the future. So please, by investing here you are not only helping the steps of a dream adventure of a talented little girl but your also investing in the future of our world.

But you might still wonder, Why should you invest in me?

Well, I believe that with your contribution, I will grow to become a better person that I am today and your investments will be paid back in the years to come with all the works and achievements I'm yet to get. As a little girl who's pure dreams of becoming a successful figure in the art world my bull ride started the moment I took a pencil in my hands but now with your help and my overwhelming ambitions, one by one we can make this word a more deep and meaningful place where every thought and aspiration has a voice to read them out loud or silent. 

for more information about the UWC program please check out their website: http://www.uwc.org.au


Can't donate?

Even though donations and investments are thanked for and greatly appreciated, if you can't donate please make this blog go viral! share it in Facebook, email, print it and give it to your next door neighbour! 

Please share this around, what are humans if we don't have connections and networks of people helping each other. 

Thank you all for being part of my adventure.

story:
Artists for Charity

The AFC Children’s Home was created to provide comprehensive (medical, educational, nutritional, and emotional) care for HIV-positive double orphans in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. 

Semira was one of the founding children of the home in 2005, when she was 8 years old. As an HIV+ orphan, she was entirely dependent on an older sibling who could not care for her.  She came to the house malnourished, without medical care, and very much in need of a family and support.  

Like many of the children, Semira blossomed at the house.  She excelled in her education.  She spoke to groups on the challenges of being an HIV+ child in Ethiopia. 

She also took care of the younger children, including a deaf child who she learned sign language to communicate with.  When that child was coming to the United States for a surgery to enable her to hear, Semira accompanied her to help her. 

Upon her graduation from school in Ethiopia, Semira was admitted to St. Francis Xavier University in Nova Scotia, with scholarship but she cannot secure loans because she's not a Canadian citizen.  

Semira aspires to be a doctor to help children like she was not so long ago. Last year many of you helped Semira start her first year at University and now she needs your help again to ensure that she can continue her education and pursue her dreams.

This year, in order for Semira to attend school in the fall, we need to raise $17,000 to cover all of her expenses.

Semira has a bright future ahead of her. Your contribution will make this dream a possibility. Can you donate to Semira's future today?

story:
What is one right of freedom from the First Amendment?



What are two rights in the Declaration of Independence?



Who is the current
Chief Justice?



A few individuals at City Life Church will be gathering with a group of immigrants
from all over the world to study questions such as these to assist them in
their preparation to take the US Citizenship test. Classes to prepare for the
US Citizenship test will be offered for eight weeks. There are very few
opportunities in our area for an immigrant to take a class such as this one and
City Life is excited to invite you to help us make US Citizenship a reality for
someone preparing for the test.



As a group, we believe that God has uniquely designed each
of us to carry out God’s work on our earth. Preparing to take the US
Citizenship class is crucial to immigrants. There is a significant cost to take
the test and immigrants seek out groups like ours to talk over questions, learn
about US government and explain “non conversational” terms in English.



We would like ot provide each participant with a workbook,
that they would be able to keep, that provides additional practice and
resources to each participant.



Would you, or your small group consider allowing God to use
you in this unique way by underwriting the cost of one, five or ten workbooks?


We are expecting 30 students. We need to raise $500.00 to successfully fund this project.



If we exceed our target, any extra money will go toward
future materials.



Thank you!

story:
Hello, and thank you for visiting!

I am beginning a new and exciting career as a Special Needs Elementary School Teacher.  I have just been assigned to teach in a self-contained 2nd/3rd grade classroom.  

I will be solely responsible for setting up my classroom. Of course the school will provide basic supplies, but I am working in a severely underfunded district, and will need to purchase many items out-of-pocket.  These may include but are not limited to:

  • Supplies (pens, pencils, paper, crayons, paints, manipulatives, et al)
  • Books
  • Furnishings (shelving, rugs, comfy seating for quiet reading, et al)
  • Decorations (posters, plants, etc)
I appreciate any help you might be able to lend, however small,  And please, only donate if you can afford to!  I am making this a short (10-day) fundraiser to raise $500, as I need to buy these items ASAP.
I am not going public with this, it is only being shown to my Facebook friends.  If you know of some generous, wealthy individuals who would like to contribute, however, feel free to share.
***Please note that although the goal is $500, I will recieve (after fees) whatever has been contributed by the end of the fundraiser.  This is not a case where if the goal isn't reached, there will be refunds issued.***
My students and I thank you in advance!
-SM
PS: Feel free to send me a message if you have any questions.

Hello, and thank you for visiting!I am beginning a new and exciting career as a Special Needs Elementary School Teacher.  I have just been assigned to teach in a self-contained 2nd/3rd grade classroom.  I will be solely responsible for setting up my classroom. Of course the school will provide basic supplies, but I am working in a severely underfunded district, and will need to purchase many items out-of-pocket.  These may include but are not limited to:
Supplies (pens, pencils, paper, crayons, paints, manipulatives, et al)
Books
Furnishings (shelving, rugs, comfy seating for quiet reading, et al)
Decorations (posters, plants, etc)
I appreciate any help you might be able to lend, however small,  And please, only donate if you can afford to!  I am making this a short (10-day) fundraiser to raise $500, as I need to buy these items ASAP.I am not going public with this, it is only being shown to my Facebook friends.  If you know of some generous, wealthy individuals who would like to contribute, however, feel free to share.***Please note that although the goal is $500, I will recieve (after fees) whatever has been contributed by the end of the fundraiser.  This is not a case where if the goal isn't reached, there will be refunds issued.***My students and I thank you in advance!-SMPS: Feel free to send me a message if you have any questions.

story:
Sickle cell Natural Wellness Group Inc.

Sickle cell affects over 200,000 in America and millions world-wide.

T.J. Brown is a sickle cell survivor, as a child he was told he wouldn't live to see 14. He is 23 years old now. Most people with his illness have a lifetime of pain and suffering. Death is a word often connected to sickle cell anemia. After having several close calls with death, T.J, chose to stand up and make a difference in his life. At one point he was bed ridden and weak, if T.J. wasn't in the hospital he would be sick at home. Through the knowledge of a natural holistic lifestyle he was able to over come something that was once thought of as impossible. After T.J.'s success with his own health he has decided to share the good news and help people all over the world. There are many who are experiencing the benefits of natural/healthy living.


The Impact


What are some activities that your organizations do in the community?

We host raw food prep classes, informational health events, and nutritional presentations at various locations. We also attend support groups and educate hospital patients. We work with clients on a one-on-one basis, and we do home visits. ☺


How has your organization made a difference in peoples lives so far?

I personally know people with SCD who were afraid of discussing the disease, they have become more vocal and are working to advance sickle cell awareness.  Many people who have had no knowledge of sickle cell became aware of it and some are even currently involved in programs that aid sickle cell patients. People who have adapted to this organic lifestyle have reported that they make less or have no more visits to the hospital. Also having less pain episodes, and experienced an overall positive renewal in both their emotional and physical state.


How can someone find you?

Sickle Cell Natural Wellness Group Inc.

naturalwellnessmovement.blogspot.com/

http://www.wix.com/SickleCellCantStopMe/Sickle-Cell-Natural-Wellness-Group-Inc

new FB GROUP

561 929 4454

Sccantstopme@comcast.net

 


Funds will enable Sickle Cell Natural Wellness Group to


Raise awareness for sickle cell.


Have more Hospital and Clinic support groups.


Take better care of the sick that don't have health insurance or money to by health supplies.


Make trips to other places in the world that sickle cell is affecting many and have them achieve the same good health t.j. has.


Provide more tools for education and suggested treatment for sickle cell.



 What You Get

(optional with donation)

$5          Daily Do's and Dont's


$35        Sickle Cell Natural Wellness Shirt & Daily Do's and Dont's


$50        A Cell from Sickle Cell Natural Wellness Group's collection & Daily Do's and Dont's


$100      A small scale painting done by Sickle Cell Natural Wellness Group & Daily Do's and Dont's


$250      Sickle cell basket & Daily Do's and Dont's




Other Ways You Can Help


Volunteer! Spread the the word to friends and family, help someone not feeling well,  share us via Face book.com twitter and email, Send us funds and tools to better assist our work!

Thank you,

T.J Brown
President

story:
Who are we?

The Terabyte Cafe is a state of the art Internet and Gaming facility coming to the city of Chester. It is a place where the city’s youth who need a strong positive outlet can come game with friends and do homework. Within the city, there is not much access to computers or the internet except for schools when they are open or the one library when it’s not busy. Our mission is to provide the community with needed access to the internet as well as education on the importance of safe internet and computer usage.

We differ from other Internet cafe’s because we seek to offer S.T.E.M based classes to the community and its youth to provide them with an opportunity to explore tech-based career options. Our classes will range from Mobile app development  all the way to web based applications. It is our goal to be able to provide these classes at little to no cost. It is a known fact that urban communities are underserved when it comes to these types of programs and we seek to fill that need.

About Chester
This is a documentary on the history of Chester written, filmed and edited by Widner students; defining what I think is the very essence of who we are and what we are about.
What We Need
To make this facility a reality we are raising $250,000. The funds raised in this campaign will go towards purchasing and renovating a building in downtown Chester. This location was decided upon because it is the central hub to the city and has a major public transportation center making it accessible to those without cars. Additionally, funding will go towards building 30 custom pcs, additional game consoles, required software, and covering payroll and training for full-time and part-time employees.


The Perks

To reach our goal we are offering a variety of perks in exchange for your support. These rewards include t-shirts, hoodies, stickers,memberships and VIP perks. 

All Contributors will have their name on Contributor wall that we will build to honor everyone who helped bring The Terabyte Cafe to life.


E.Y.P Hoodie - $55


T.C Hoodie - $55


E.Y.P T-Shirt - $25


T.C T-Shirt - $25


The Terabyte Cafe Stickers - $5

Why Fund Us?

As a native of Chester, I have seen where the city has been as well as where it is going. We are working with other minority-owned small businesses in the city that are pushing to make a real change not only to the city but to the community as well. We believe that the city’s youth is the key to bringing prosperity back and allow us to begin to write our own narrative on who we are and what we are about. With The Terabyte Cafe, we have a tremendous opportunity to serve as a place to keep teens and young adult off the streets as well as give them a place that they can feel comfortable to express themselves as well as interact with other that share their same interests. By supporting us you're supporting change. By supporting us you are building a community. By supporting us you are giving us a voice.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone has the means to make a monetary donation. If you would still like to support our cause, please follow us on Facebook and Twitter, and help us spread the word about our campaign!

story:
The Gardens at Butterfly Falls

In 2012, I purchased a 40 acre tract of land in Picayune, MS with the intentions of turning the unused space into beautiful Gardens.  After clearing, scraping, draining, leveling, prepping, seeding, and praying, I have finally gotten to the point where the landscaping can begin.  The design of the Gardens is a predetermined outline of a child's maze.  With each twist and turn of the paths, dead ends and obstacles will be found as well as delightful surprises tucked in the corners.


The Gardens will be the first of its kind within a 200- mile radius and the only one of its kind on the Mississippi Gulf Coast.

What once began as a labor of love, has now turned into a passion for the community as well.  We have been inuadated with offers of help to plant, to sow, to mow and to water. What we don't have at the moment is the actual materials.  That's where you come in.  Each and every contribution, no matter how small,  helps getting us one step closer to the dream.

The expected opening of the Gardens is scheduled for March 2, 2015.  If you sponsor any plantings or trees or fountains, you will be invited to the opening so that you can come look and take photos with your gift, marked with your name sake.

What We Need & What You Get

“Great things are done by a series of small things brought together.” – Vincent Van Gogh:

The Gardens have been broken down into a series of smaller phases. 

  1. STEPPING STONES:  The path of the stepping stones will lead to, through, and around the obstacles of the maze, eventually coming to the focal point, the water fountain. Although not the actual stones, these represent only a few of the several thousand we will need.  

  2. MONKEY GRASS; The outline or borders of the Maze wil be defined by flower beds specifically placed as to define the pathways.  Along these flower beds, the borders will be lined with Monkey grass, lots and lots of it.  Over time this clumps of Monkey grass will grow together creating a unified line, but the initial planting will take hundreds if not thousands of clumps. 
  3. FRUIT TREES: Throughout the botanical gardens, trees will be placed strategically in rows, dotted along walkways, and placed in specific beds, but no tree can be as interesting and functional as a fruit tree.  There will be a multitude of variety to plant; Apple, Orange, Lemon, Peach, etc.  With each sponsorship of a tree, you will receive a plaque next to the tree, giving the date it was planted and the name of the sponsor.  
  4. CREPE MYRTLES: A beautiful and delicate tree indeed.  Light and airy with pastel blossoms, this tree will be a great assest to any Garden.  With the sponsorship of this tree, a plaque will be placed next to the tree with the name of your choosing. This photo represents only one of the many colors that will be planted in the Gardens.

  5. LIVE OAKS:  These are the most majestic of all trees, with its strength and stature, these trees will be around for generations to come.  These particular trees will be the staple of our botanical Gardens.  They are quite expensive at $100.00 a piece, but will be well worth the price considering the beauty, shade, and emphasis to the Garden
  6. WEEPING WILLOW: Often associated with mourning and grief, this could not be furthest from the truth.  The weeping willow is determined to find water with its strong roots, and its ability to adapt to environment changes with is bending branches.  Put your name on this tree and have it ever immortalized for generations to come.  

  7. VEGETABLE GARDEN:  A bed all by its self.  This vegetable garden inside the botanical gardens will give visitors of all ages an opportunity to work, produce, and yield a crop of our own local vegetables.  With this sponsorship an entire bed and one segment of the maze will be dedicated to nothing but the vegetables.  A plaque with your name will be grounded into the Head of The Vegetable Garden itself.  
  8. ROSE GARDEN: Ever wanted your very own rose garden without all the work.  Now you can.  Sponsor this Garden and you can name it.  Want to immortalize your mother for generations, nothing says, "I love you" like a Rose Garden bearing her name.
  9. WATER FOUNTAIN; The focal point of the Garden.  In the center of the maze will be the pride and joy of it all, the water fountain.  This water fountain is a 4 tiered, 8 foot in diameter, 12 feet tall, free flowing fountain.  Its beautiful, tranquil, and above all else will carry your name or that of your loved one. 

  10. NAMING OF THE BOTANICAL GARDENS: Always dream of leaving your legacy behind, well now you can.  For the sum of $20,000 you can name the Botanical Gardens after yourself, your loved ones, or your company sponsorship.  Have thousands of people every day, all day, associate your name with that of a beautiful botanical garden.  A grand arbor with an entrance to rival that of royalty will be constructed upon entry into the Gardens, with your name above the Gardens, all promotional venues and Garden advertisements and anything associated with the promotion of the Gardens will bear your name.  Wanna name it for your loved ones, The Mona T. Scott Memorial Gardens?!, Wanna name it after Troop 472?!  Done!.  Although our dream is represented in these photos, remember they are not yet a reality without your support

The Impact

Its no secret that botanical gardens are beautiful, but they are also educational and therapeutic.  Many students from neighboring communities were dumbfounded to learn that vegetables actually grow from the ground and fruit were born of trees.  Grocery stores have become a staple of cities and towns to the point children are no longer aware where their food comes.  

A simple stroll through the Gardens?! Anything but,.  Not only providing exercise but fresh air, and the tranquility to clear ones thoughts.  Help make the dream a reality by sponsoring one of our smaller phases, leading to the overall picture. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially?  No worries, just please continue to keeps us in your thoughts and prayers.  Our expected opening date is March 2, 2014.  Come out, visit, and relax in the beautiful Gardens.  If you sponsored a planting, look for your tree and plaque among the Gardens.  Please continue to invite your friend to like and share this page and information.  Thanks so much!!!

story:
IMAGINE a school where children are taught from the inside out, creatively engaged with their hearts and bodies, revered as whole human beings, each unfolding in their own time.  Academic subjects are infused with art, music, movement, imagination and practical life skills, teaching to multiple intelligences and learning styles.  Cultivating compassion for one another and the natural world is a part of their everyday learning.

 

      

 

This is Blossom Valley School, a Waldorf-inspired, Kindergarten-8th grade, located in the verdant valley of Paonia, Colorado, in Delta County.  This area is steeped in an agricultural tradition, with the largest number of organic and biodynamic farms per capita than anywhere else in the US.  We have also been designated a Colorado Creative District due to the large number of artists and musicians practicing in our area. Waldorf-inspired education incorporates farming, art, movement and music into every aspect of the curriculum, making a Waldorf-inspired school a perfect fit for our community and culture.

 

 

Providing a deeply nourishing foundation for our children is invaluable.  While we have been blessed by a strong group of committed parents and teachers, our school is struggling to balance our budget this year.  In previous years, we had access to public funds through a homeschooling program, but these funds are not available to us this year.  Our enrollment is lower than we projected, for financial reasons, and several families are requesting financial assistance due to hardship.  Delta County’s average household income is below the state’s average.  Blossom Valley families have prioritized this type of education above all else, even when it is a financial hardship for them. In order to make our budget balance, our teachers have agreed to an inadequate wage and parents and community members are volunteering hundreds of hours to keep our program going. Children are making their main lesson books rather than buying them and teachers are buying supplies with their personal funds. We are committed to building upon the excellent start we have made in the last three years.  In order to continue building, we must make it through this year.

Our team has written and submitted an application to become a charter school for the 2014-2015 school year.  If this is approved, we will be able to offer tuition-free, Waldorf-inspired classes to anyone who wants it.

 

 

We are asking for your help.

Your gift in the amount of $25 and up will go to directly enrich the hearts and minds of our children. Our goal of $48,000 will fund teachers’ salaries and much needed materials that will keep us going until the end of the school year.  By helping us reach our goal, you will provide a tuition-free year for five children in grades 1-8, and tuition assistance for five preschool/ kindergarten children. You do not have to contribute the amounts defined for the perks on the right.  Any amount you choose to give is appreciated.  You will receive a confirmation of your donation from FirstGiving.com (the Indiegogo payment processor), and the payment will go to The Learning Cooperative (our fiscal agent).  If we exceed our goal, funds will be put toward tuition-assistance for next year, in the event our charter is not approved, or a building for us if it is approved.

 

 

If you are unable to contribute monetarily, please help us spread the word! You can share this campaign on your social media; Like, Tweet, or Google +1 it; send a link in an email to your friends; ask your friends to share; embed a link on your website; follow us to get updates; and interact with this page - the more activity we get, the more the campaign is seen. 

You are all valuable members of our community! Thank you for helping us continue to bring a unique and outstanding education to the children of the North Fork Valley, preparing them for a future of unlimited possibilities in a complicated and unpredictable world.

Please visit us online:

http://blossomvalleyschool.org

https://www.facebook.com/blossomvalleyschool

Children are making their main lesson books rather than buying them and teachers are buying supplies with their personal funds. We are committed to building upon the excellent start we have made in the last three years.  In order to continue building, we must make it through this year.Our team has written and submitted an application to become a charter school for the 2014-2015 school year.  If this is approved, we will be able to offer tuition-free, Waldorf-inspired classes to anyone who wants it.  We are asking for your help.Your gift in the amount of $25 and up will go to directly enrich the hearts and minds of our children. Our goal of $48,000 will fund teachers’ salaries and much needed materials that will keep us going until the end of the school year.  By helping us reach our goal, you will provide a tuition-free year for five children in grades 1-8, and tuition assistance for five preschool/ kindergarten children. You do not have to contribute the amounts defined for the perks on the right.  Any amount you choose to give is appreciated.  You will receive a confirmation of your donation from FirstGiving.com (the Indiegogo payment processor), and the payment will go to The Learning Cooperative (our fiscal agent).  If we exceed our goal, funds will be put toward tuition-assistance for next year, in the event our charter is not approved, or a building for us if it is approved.  If you are unable to contribute monetarily, please help us spread the word! You can share this campaign on your social media; Like, Tweet, or Google +1 it; send a link in an email to your friends; ask your friends to share; embed a link on your website; follow us to get updates; and interact with this page - the more activity we get, the more the campaign is seen. You are all valuable members of our community! Thank you for helping us continue to bring a unique and outstanding education to the children of the North Fork Valley, preparing them for a future of unlimited possibilities in a complicated and unpredictable world. Please visit us online:http://blossomvalleyschool.orghttps://www.facebook.com/blossomvalleyschool

story:
Creator Space

Releasing Creative Ability

Empowering Technical Learning

Providing Access To High-Tech Tools


Ever dream of using a tool you just can't afford to buy?

Maybe just for that one special project?

To make a prototype or a gift, but no one you know has it?

Now there is somewhere to go...


The Creator Space!


You need to use a Plasma Cutter or CNC/CAM Router? Perhaps the 3D Printer? Use the space and equipment on your schedule. Buy a monthly membership for unlimited hobby use. Meet other Makers and collaborate...


Better than the gym membership you never use...


Creator Space

Open-Source Workshops!


Tinkering. Designing. Building... However you look at it, we all long to be creative. Some paint. Some dance. You are a Maker. A Creator. Or you call yourself an Experimenter, or Tinkerer, or Inventor. Woman or Man, we all have a bit of that "spark" in our brain. That raw power of creativity that drives us. We think in mechanisms and circuits. Unfortunately few experimenters and hobbyists have the financial resources and tools to fully engage our "Inner Engineer."

The Creator Space will make tools and space available to community members, allowing them to use costly and complex equipment normally beyond the reach of the average tinkerer, inventor, or experimenter. These include: Plasma CAM System, Laser Cutter and Engraver System, Oxy/Acetylene + MIG and TIG Welding Center, Electronics Bench, Woodworking Tools and more... Much More!


Here Is The Big Idea...

You need a welder... Drop in to Creator Space and get it welded.
          Quick repairs or ornamental works of art. MIG, TIG and Gas.

A design calls for a programmable plasma cutter...
          Draft your cutting plans at home and head over to Creator Space.
          Whip them out on the Plasma CNC system in just a few minutes.
          Build your dream project quickly or create a prototype and go to Shark Tank!

A wedding present needs laser engraving...
          Pop a wine bottle in the engraver at Creator Space and voila!
          Make wooden, plastic or metal ornaments and children's toys.
          Personalize your employee ID/RFID badge, smart phone or laptop.

Plus...
#  Dedicated, secure space for your project. Low monthly fees for locked storage.

#  Fully-equipped electronics workbenches at Creator Space with soldering irons, multiple-output power supplies and all the hand tools you need. Testing and troubleshooting equipment at the ready (if needed) including oscilloscopes and logic analyzers. Even a selection of parts, if missing that one, last piece!

#  Have a Creator Class party! Invite a group of friends to the Creator Space to learn the Plasma CNC or MIG Welder and each build a project to kick off a new hobby of creating and making. Know anyone in Scout Troops, Ham Radio Clubs, School Clubs, Knitting Groups, Sewing Group, Book Clubs, Church or Singles Groups? I bet you can think of a bunch of people who would like to attend a private creator party!


How The Creator Space Works:

The use of Creator Space facilities and equipment will be based on a recurring monthly membership basis. Similar to the traditional gym membership, but without the problems of over-enrollment or waiting for a turn. You can even schedule a machine in advance.

Members will be allowed access to equipment following basic training in safety and tool use. Individuals can enroll in scheduled classes and groups can schedule custom curriculum without additional cost. The basic cost for members will be $75 per month and discounts for commitments will save members up to 25% or more. Options for spouse and family memberships are also available... We are still working out all the details, so stay tuned to this page for more details! Subscribe or follow us on Facebook!

The Creator Space will provide the tools and space for men and women, teens and families, to explore their engineering creativity. For the Creator in us all!


I need YOU to assist the community!

To turn this dream into reality we need funds to purchase:

  • Concrete Pad and Steel Building
  • Electrical Wiring, Plumbing and Restroom
  • Electronics Work Benches with Hand Tools and Test Equipment
  • Plasma CAM, Laser Cutter/Engraver Systems
  • Wood Lathe, Table Saw, Drill Press, etc...
  • Gas and Arc Welding Equipment
  • Computer Design Center with Laser Printer and 3D Printer
  • Computer Security, Access and Monitoring System
  • Public Awareness and Outreach

Plus, your contribution may be tax deductible! The Civilized Frontier is a California Nonprofit Corporation. 501(c)(3) Application in process...
